title: Moderating effects of self-defined sexual orientation on the relation between social factors and depressive symptoms or suicidal ideation among French young adults
abstract: purpose disparity mental health across sexual orientation group among young adult long discussed . aim cross-sectional study investigate moderating effect sexual orientation association social factor depressive symptom well suicidal ideation young adult . method study included 6,337 participant aged 18–25y 2022 french epicov cohort . outcome variable depressive symptom suicidal ideation . poisson regression robust error variance performed investigate association social factor outcome according sexual orientation ( lesbian , gay , bisexual , , defining according sexuality : sexual minority ( sm ) ; heterosexual wishing answer : belonging sm ( nsm ) ) . result prevalence depressive symptom suicidal ideation higher sm nsm group . regarding depressive symptom , significant moderating effect sexual orientation observed female v male sex ( nsm : adjusted prevalence ratio ( apr ) 1.58 [ 1.28–1.95 ] , sm : apr 1.03 [ 0.78–1.36 ] ) age category 22–25y v 18-21y ( nsm : apr 1.32 [ 1.05–1.67 ] , sm : apr 0.78 [ 0.59–1.03 ] ) . regarding suicidal ideation , significant moderating effect observed v relationship ( nsm : apr 1.55 [ 1.14–2.12 ] , sm : apr 0.82 [ 0.59–1.13 ] ) . conclusion study conducted 2022 , well-known social risk factor mental problem explain higher prevalence depressive symptom suicidal ideation among young sm group . study needed understand specific challenge faced young people .

title: The association of objectively and subjectively measured modifiable lifestyle factors with internalizing problems: the role of genetic confounding and shared method variance bias
abstract: background sleep duration physical activity associated internalizing problem . however , genetic confounding measurement error may introduce bias . assessed genetic confounding association modifiable lifestyle internalizing problem using device-based questionnaire assessment estimate shared genetic risk across different assessment adolescent . method preregistered study adolescent brain cognitive development cohort , included european adolescent self-reported device-based sleep duration ( n = 2283 ) moderate/vigorous physical activity ( mvpa , days/week , n = 2772 ) . used brief problem monitor self-reported internalizing problem score . genetic sensitivity analysis conducted genetic confounding combining polygenic score molecular-based heritability internalizing problem . result longer sleep duration associated lower internalizing problem using self-reported ( -0.15-sd , se = 0.02-sd ) objective ( -0.10-sd , se = 0.02-sd ) assessment . frequent mvpa associated lower internalizing problem using self-reported ( -0.09-sd , se = 0.02-sd ) device-based ( -0.06-sd , se = 0.02-sd ) assessment . substantial genetic confounding ( 81 % ) found self-reported sleep duration internalizing problem , predominantly among boy . clear evidence genetic confounding found association device-based sleep duration either measure mvpa internalizing problem . conclusion observed negative relationship reported child sleep duration internalizing problem may partly due genetic confounding , particularly among boy . genetic influence likely captured reporting measurement error shared method variance . impact adolescent sleep duration internalizing problem may overestimated self-reports , especially among boy , whereas association physical activity genetically confounded .

title: Psychological resilience trajectories after the COVID-19 pandemic: the role of lifestyle and psychosocial factors in a cohort at increased alzheimer’s disease risk
abstract: purpose longitudinal cohort study evaluates whether lifestyle psychosocial factor associated psychological resilience two time point covid-19 pandemic . moreover , investigated mediating role perceived stress association . method total 677 cognitively unimpaired ( cu ) older adult increased risk alzheimer ’ disease ( ad ) completed hospital anxiety depression scale ( hads ) . based reliable change index ( rci ) , hads trajectory defined two interval : ( 1 ) pre-pandemic-confinement ( follow-up = 2,28 ± 0,84 year ) ; ( 2 ) confinement-post-confinement ( follow-up = 1,49 ± 0,12 year ) . , 4 trajectory group defined : psychological resilience ( n = 448 , stable improve interval ) , descending ( n = 84 , stable/improve [ interval 1 ] -worsen [ interval 2 ] ) , recovery ( n = 59 , worsening [ interval 1 ] , improvement [ interval 2 ] ) non-resilient ( n = 86 , worsening interval ) . logistic regression model ( lrm ) applied considering lifestyle ( physical leisure activity , sleep ) psychosocial factor ( social relationship emotional support ) predictor psychological resilience trajectory ( i.e . , outcome ) interval . finally , mediation analysis carried test effect perceived stress relationship predictive factor psychological resilience . result finding showed participant followed psychological resilient trajectory ( 66,1 % ) . lrms indicated higher physical activity level , greater number social interaction longer sleep duration significantly associated psychological resilience trajectory confinement 1.5 year follow-up . lastly , mediation analysis suggested factor influence psychological resilience mitigation perceived stress . conclusion finding underscore role physical activity , social interaction sleep quality strengthen individual ’ capacity cope stress prolonged crisis covid-19 pandemic . lifestyle psychological factor may valuable target public health strategy aimed prevent mental health problem .

title: Health and well-being comparison between residents of serviced housing for older people and community-dwelling older adults in japan: a propensity score matching analysis
abstract: purpose serviced housing older people ( shop ) japan offer barrier-free living environment supportive service enhance health well-being older adult . study aimed compare health well-being shop resident community-dwelling older adult compare factor may influence . method cross-sectional study utilized propensity score matching compare health well-being 1,080 shop resident ( 69.4 % female ; mean age : 83.9 year ) 7,560 community-dwelling older adult ( 67.8 % female ; mean age : 84.1 year ) japan gerontological evaluation study . health well-being assessed using nine item . additionally , social behaviour social factor laughing frequency , regular outing , hobby , depression , participation preventive care activity , meeting friend frequently , emotional support , eating others , compared . result shop resident exhibited significantly higher level happiness , life satisfaction , physical health compared community-dwelling older adult . engaged activity like regular outing , attending preventive care activity , meeting friend , eating others . also reported higher frequency laughter received emotional support . conclusion shop may improve health well-being older adult . finding help developing age-friendly housing initiative address challenge aging society .

title: Resilient outcomes in people with a history of mental disorder during the COVID-19 pandemic: an international 2-years longitudinal prospective study
abstract: background covid-19 pandemic , global population exposed significant psychological stress , impact mental health individual pre-existing mental disorder . despite heightened vulnerability , subgroup within population demonstrated resilient outcome throughout pandemic . study aim identify predictor long-term , sustained resilient outcome among people history mental disorder first two year pandemic . method international 2-year , 5-wave longitudinal online survey , patient health questionnaire-9 , generalized anxiety disorder scale , ptsd checklist dsm-5 used proxy measure psychological distress . possible predictor sustained resilient outcome , investigated socio-demographic characteristic , economic housing status , pandemic-related issue , chronic disease , social support , fear contamination personal value investigated respectively oslo social support scale , padua inventory , portrait value questionnaire . data analysed mover-stayer latent transition analysis model . result nine-hundred forty-three participant mental disorder included analysis . variable associated higher chance sustained resilient outcome older age , maintaining job , people household . contrast , female gender , losing job , difficulty meeting basic need , higher fear contamination , hedonism , le social support loneliness resulted lower likelihood presenting sustained resilient outcome . conclusion study identified factor predictsustained resilience people mental disorder . newly discovered predictor could prove invaluable developing strategy enhance resilience people mental disorder time crisis , pandemic .

title: Factors related to the occurrence of mass psychogenic illness in schools: a systematic review
abstract: background mass psychogenic illness ( mpi ) , also known mass hysteria , phenomenon group individual exhibit similar symptom without identifiable organic cause . mpi outbreak school setting lead significant disruption psychological distress among student . systematic review aimed identify characterize factor contributing initiation progression mpi outbreak school analysis existing literature . method comprehensive search conducted electronic database , including cochrane library , pubmed , embase , web science identify relevant article published english . study screened based predefined inclusion exclusion criterion . moreover , grey literature search , hand searching , backward/forward citation searching performed . data extraction performed using standardized form collect information outbreak characteristic , contributing factor , symptom pattern . result nineteen study included . identified 10 distinct factor associated mpi outbreak school , including ( 1 ) spread rumor misinformation , ( 2 ) community pressure persistent rumor dissemination , ( 3 ) lack attention mental disorder , ( 4 ) anxiety due pseudo causation , ( 5 ) negative perception authority , ( 6 ) presence psychological stressor , ( 7 ) medium coverage public anxiety , ( 8 ) physical proximity perceived threat , ( 9 ) social medium influence , ( 10 ) psychological vulnerability . factor found act causal trigger exacerbating element , leading initiation amplification mpi outbreak . conclusion study highlight complex nature mpi outbreak school setting emphasizes importance understanding social psychological factor contribute occurrence spread . identified factor serve valuable indicator school health authority effectively manage support student incident . research needed explore interplay factor different cultural educational context develop targeted intervention prevention mitigation mpi outbreak school .

title: Psychological distress and mental health disparities over time between tertiary students and non-student working peers in Australia
abstract: purpose tertiary student recognised high-risk population psychological distress yet , australia , overlooked population-level surveillance , health service provision mental health policy . study sought explore trend self-reported psychological distress general mental health tertiary student compared non-student working peer australia 2007 2022— timeframe span pre- , mid- , immediate-post-covid time period . method household , income labour dynamic australia ( hilda ) survey used basis study . focusing participant aged 18 35 survey wave spanning 2007 2022 ( average n = 4415 per year ) , participant categorised three group : working , tertiary student working , tertiary student . psychological distress general mental health measured using kessler-10 scale mental health inventory-5 , respectively . weighted regression model compared outcome student non-students . result psychological distress poor mental health risen among young australian , sharpest increase since 2019. tertiary student , especially studying , showed significantly higher distress poorer mental health working peer . although adjusting sociodemographic socioeconomic covariates attenuated association , higher distress level student persisted post-2019 . loneliness , long-term disability , poor general health correlate poor mental health across group . conclusion finding highlight need targeted care model tertiary student , including enhanced campus mental health support screening service , financial support , social connection program , digital health solution .

title: Prospective prediction of first onset of major depressive disorder in midlife using machine learning
abstract: purpose paper leverage machine learning ( ml ) model prospectively predict first onset major depressive disorder ( mdd ) , one common disabling mental health condition . prediction model hold potential enabling early intervention , study applied ml approach task , heterogeneous nature . moreover , clinical utility predictive model remains largely unexamined . method data stemmed colaus|psycolaus , population-based cohort study . total , 1350 participant , age 35–66 year without lifetime mdd baseline participated physical psychiatric baseline least one psychiatric follow-up evaluation . model based logistic regression , elastic net , random forest , xgboost trained using extensive array psychosocial , environmental , biological , genetic predictor . discriminative performance , calibration , clinical utility , individual predictor contribution assessed using nested cross-validation . result discriminative performance comparable model ( area precision-recall curve 0.36 0.38 ; area receiver operating characteristic curve 0.65 0.68 ) . decision curve analysis suggested clinical utility logistic regression , elastic net , random forest threshold probability 10 % 40 % . across model , neuroticism , sex , age important predictor . conclusion although prediction model achieved discriminative performance level chance , refinement necessary . addition biological genetic predictor elevate performance markedly . additional research seems warranted given limited number heterogeneous nature existing study , burden associated mdd , potential improve overall outcome people risk mdd .

title: Investigating psychosocial factors and systemic inflammation using dried blood spots: a scoping review
abstract: purpose scoping review two primary aim : ( 1 ) synthesize u.s.-based study utilizing dried blood spot ( db ) sampling examine association psychosocial factor systemic inflammation , measured c-reactive protein ( crp ) , ( 2 ) evaluate methodological utility db advancing inclusive , population-based biomarker research . explore db adoption , variability method finding , approach enhance understanding health disparity driven psychosocial stressor . method comprehensive search database including medline , embase , cochrane library , cinahl plus , psycinfo conducted . inclusion criterion encompassed u.s.-based study employing db sampling quantify crp relation psychosocial factor . study categorized four domain : socioeconomic neighborhood context , adverse life event trauma , social experience interpersonal dynamic , mental health emotional well-being . data extracted , synthesized , narratively analyzed . result thirty study met inclusion criterion , sample size ranging 20 13,236. key finding indicated strong association psychosocial stressor ( e.g . , discrimination , social isolation ) elevated crp . study conducted sex- gender-based analysis . db particularly effective research underrepresented population , enabling cost-effective , minimally invasive sampling diverse resource-limited setting . conclusion review highlight db important tool psychiatric biomarker research , offering scalability inclusivity . finding affirm link psychosocial factor systemic inflammation , suggesting avenue targeted intervention . future research explore additional biomarkers psychosocial determinant sex stratified analysis better understand inflammation-related health disparity .

title: Using difficulty in going out and social participation to assess for risk of hikikomori: nationally representative data from the European health interview survey
abstract: purpose epidemiologic study hikikomori , form prolonged social withdrawal , limited . study aimed look indicator european country problem first detected japan , estimating prevalence hikikomori risk examining relationship hikikomori risk sociodemographic factor , health status , health service use . method data european health interview survey collected 2019 used , consisting nationally representative sample ( unweighted n = 45,962 ; weighted n = 52,012,922.578 ) person aged 15–75 year italy . difficulty going due medical illnesses/functional limitation chronic illness considered proxy condition hikikomori , i.e . , hikikomori risk . hikikomori risk differentiated based difficulty social participation . result overall prevalence hikikomori risk 1.7 % ( 95 % ci : 1.6–1.9 ) corresponding weighted count 866,743 person . comprised 0.7 % prevalence hikikomori risk difficulty social participation ( 95 % ci : 0.6–0.8 % ; weighted n = 343,920 ) , 0.9 % prevalence hikikomori difficulty social participation ( 95 % ci : 0.8–1.0 % ; weighted n = 445,165 ) 0.1 % prevalence hikikomori risk interest social participation ( 95 % ci : 0.1–0.2 % ; weighted n = 77,657 ) . low vitality mental health index , low social support , high depressive symptom , difficulty accessing mental health service significantly associated hikikomori risk . conclusion prevalence individual risk hikikomori par many psychiatric disorder . given prevalence functional impairment faced individual risk hikikomori , represent group worthy attention public health expert stakeholder health arena beyond .

title: Perceived risk of illicit drug consumption in singapore: findings from a nationwide survey
abstract: background study aimed identify group risk perception illicit drug consumption associated sociodemographic mental health factor singapore . method representative sample 6,509 singapore citizen permanent resident aged 15 65 year randomly selected participation 14 month . information perceived risk related illicit drug consumption , correlate collected via questionnaire . data analysed using latent class analysis identify risk perception profile . logistic regression analysis performed determine sociodemographic mental health correlate across different risk perception profile . result four profile emerged ; high risk perception across substance frequency , low risk perception across substance frequency , low risk perception cannabis , low risk perception occasional illicit drug consumption . 9.4 % ( n = 557 ) reported low risk perception cannabis . male ( vs. female , rr : 2.15 , 95 % ci : 1.57–2.94 ) likely low risk perception cannabis . aged 35–65 year ( 35–49 vs. 15–34 , rr : 0.37 , 95 % ci : 0.25–0.54 ; 50–65 vs. 15–34 , rr : 0.19 , 95 % ci : 0.10–0.37 ) , secondary school ( vs. degree , rr : 0.23 , 95 % ci : 0.13–0.39 ) pre-tertiary ( vs. degree , rr : 0.42 , 95 % ci : 0.29–0.61 ) education le likely low risk perception cannabis . ever-smokers ( vs. non-smokers , rr : 1.86 , 95 % ci : 1.31–2.64 ) , grouped “ safe drinking ” ( vs. abstainer , rr : 3.80 , 95 % ci : 2.50–5.77 ) “ hazardous drinking ” ( vs. abstainer , rr : 7.00 , 95 % ci : 3.69–13.28 ) likely perceive low risk cannabis . individual low risk perception across substance profile likely report symptom anxiety ( : 7.17 , 95 % ci : 1.31–38.98 ) compared high risk perception across substance frequency individual . conclusion finding provide critical insight tailoring prevention education initiative address substance use behaviour singapore .

title: A systematic review on the impact of climate change on occupational mental health: a focus on vulnerable industries
abstract: aim systematic review aim examine climate change related stressor may affect mental health worker industry vulnerable climate change . review also seek evaluate coping strategy used affected worker , well potential intervention mitigate prevent mental health effect . method literature search conducted june 2024 database pubmed , embase , psycinfo web science , using combination keywords climate change , mental health illness , vulnerable industry . result predominance accessed literature related agricultural industry , minority pertaining aquaculture , construction aviation industry . suggest increased vulnerability worker mental health-related problem , including increased depression , anxiety , psychological distress suicidality response stressor increased temperature prolonged drought condition . besides socioeconomic effect resulting reduced productivity , climate-related stressor may contribute increased uncertainty , isolation , perceived lack control , challenge sense identity . coping method varied influenced outcome mental wellbeing , community wellbeing social connectedness agricultural setting observed beneficial effect level psychological distress . intervention promoted mental health literacy , availability mental health first aid , social cohesion , adaptability climate stressor deemed helpful . conclusion environmental stressor interact mental health intricate manner , exerting influence biological socioeconomic aspect person ’ well-being . occupational setting , stressor may also affect social cohesion one ’ personal sense identity self-esteem . building strong social network structure enable self-efficacy adaptability towards climate change may key towards promoting mental health resilience amongst worker vulnerable industry .

abstract: purpose social status related disparity health well-being outcome people dementia ( pwd ) . study explored interpersonal influence social status pwd well-being caregiver , vice versa . investigated relationship using measure objective perceived ( subjective ) social status . method actor-partner interdependence model used investigate dyadic relationship social status well-being 1042 pwd spousal caregiver ideal study . objective indicator social status included education , social class socioeconomic classification . perceived social status included social comparison rating status society one ’ community . result objective social status indicator , actor effect observed caregiver education well-being . actor effect perceived social status stronger independent objective social status pwd caregiver . caregiver social status also influenced well-being pwd . conclusion study provides empirical evidence interpersonal influence social status , especially perceived social status , well-being pwd caregiver . interaction pwd , caregiver wider society may influence perception relative social position impact living well dementia .

title: Agreement between child- and informant-based mental health assessments: results from a national population-based study in Lebanon
abstract: purpose given importance accurate assessment child psychopathology early intervention , study aim examine agreement informant child mental health assessment first national psychopathology child adolescent lebanon study ( pal ) identify socioeconomic , family composition , health , child-related factor associated agreement . method pal study includes assessment depression ( mood feeling questionnaire [ mfq ] ) , anxiety ( screen child anxiety related emotional disorder [ scared ] ) , emotional behavioral difficulty ( strength feeling questionnaire [ sdq ] ) children/adolescents informant report . examined agreement using cohen ’ kappa factor related agreement/disagreement using adjusted logistic regression . result kappa child-informant agreement psychopathology , depression , anxiety , emotional/behavioral assessment 0.29 [ 95 % ci = 0.23–0.36 ] , 0.24 [ 95 % ci = 0.12–0.36 ] , 0.24 [ 95 % ci = 0.17–0.31 ] , 0.14 [ 95 % ci = 0.02–0.26 ] , respectively . important disagreement found anxiety emotional/behavioral difficulty : child-based anxiety prevalence 16.52 % , informant-based prevalence 10.91 % ; informant-based emotional/behavioral difficulty prevalence 9.48 % , whereas child-based prevalence 5.01 % . higher disagreement associated lower parental socioeconomic indicator , poorer academic performance , child physical illness , family psychiatric history , previous child mental health service use . conclusion result show low agreement child- informant-based mental health assessment lebanon , disorder-specific discrepancy . disagreement exacerbated lower parental socioeconomic indicator familial psychiatric history tracked academic difficulty child health . result suggest integrating multiple informant type information enhances mental health assessment , particularly context highly needed research , clinical , policy effort .

title: Longitudinal relationships between ADHD symptoms and internet addiction among Chinese adolescents: a cross-lagged panel network analysis
abstract: background comorbidity mechanism adhd symptom internet addiction yet clear , network analysis provides new perspective clarifying research question . aim therefore , study employed cross-lagged panel network model examine specific symptom level adhd internet addiction interact . method total 732 chinese adolescent ( 55.6 % girl , age = 13.95 year , sd = 1.55 ) completed assessment three time point spaced six month apart . result 4.51 6.83 % participant showed severe internet issue , 8.06–9.97 % fell adhd abnormal range across three time point . result contemporaneous network indicated bridge symptom three-time point “ inattention ” . result temporal network showed : ( 1 ) core symptom responsible comorbidity mostly belong adhd symptom ; ( 2 ) comorbidity mechanism change time , predictive bridge symptom “ hyperactivity ” t1 t2 network , changing “ inattention ” t2 t3 network . addition , “ excessive use ” vulnerable symptom . conclusion finding suggest hyperactivity early adolescence inattention later stage may serve temporal risk indicator internet addiction , intervention targeting symptom could worthy investigation .

title: Deaths in patients with psychiatric disorders: a 10-year retrospective records review in Northern Tunisia
abstract: background patient psychiatric disorder experience higher all-cause mortality compared general population . aim study investigate cause death psychiatric patient . method retrospectively reviewed medical autopsy record clinically diagnosed psychiatric patient underwent autopsy , january 2012 december 2021. collected data related demographic , medical history autopsy finding . statistical analysis included descriptive statistic , crossing trend analysis . result total 826 death among psychiatric patient collected , including 622 ( 75.3 % ) men 204 ( 24.7 % ) woman . rate death psychiatric patient increased year ( r^2 = 0.65 ) . mean age death 47.3 ± 13.9 year . schizophrenia frequent psychiatric diagnosis ( 41.4 % ) . 331 ( 40.1 % ) receiving antipsychotic drug . primary manner death suicide ( 53.2 % ) , hanging ( 23 % ) drowning ( 7.6 % ) frequent method . natural cause accounted 23.8 % ( primarily cardiovascular disease ( 56.9 % ) respiratory disorder ( 14.7 % ) ) , followed undetermined death ( 21.4 % ) homicide ( 1.6 % ) . conclusion suicide cardiovascular disease major cause death psychiatric patient . suicide risk stratification , lifestyle cardio-metabolic factor modification careful antipsychotic management crucial reducing mortality psychiatric patient .

abstract: purpose growing body research relationship water , sanitation , hygiene ( wash ) insecurity mental health . goal research understand relationship wash insecurity psychological wellbeing one community juba , south sudan , using participatory approach community member . aimed : ( 1 ) explore kind wash insecurity experienced south sudan ; ( 2 ) hear community member understood relationship insecurity psychological wellbeing . method total 56 adult community rejah , south sudan , participated study . used concept mapping develop conceptual framework community member viewed relationship wash insecurity psychological wellbeing . participant engaged three round data collection included brainstorming idea , sorting idea meaningful group , providing feedback . result men generated 33 statement related wash insecurity psychological wellbeing , woman generated 34. men ’ idea grouped 5 cluster , one focused positive impact ; woman ’ idea grouped 6 cluster , two focused fear related gender-based violence danger . together , men woman articulated wide variety negative impact wash insecurity psychological wellbeing , including sadness , shame , stress , worry , fear , afraid , “ thinking much ” , low self-esteem . conclusion focus needed psychosocial impact wash insecurity among individual conflict post-conflict setting . addressing daily stressor may positive impact mental distress .

title: Cluster B personality disorders and psychotropic medications: a focused analysis of trends and patterns across sex and age groups
abstract: purpose study investigated sex age difference pattern psychotropic medication use initial diagnosis cluster b personality disorder ( pd ) analyzed trend time . method analyzing data quebec integrated chronic disease surveillance system individual newly diagnosed cluster b pd ( ≥ 14 year ) 2002 2018 provincial public drug plan , calculated yearly monthly proportion individual exposed psychotropic medication year diagnosis sex age . robust poisson regression model assessed association sex exposure psychotropic medication diagnosis cluster b pd . result among 87,778 individual first cluster b pd diagnosis ( mean age : 44.5 year ; 57.5 % woman ) , proportion user increased post-diagnosis . notably , diagnosis , female likely receive psychiatric medication ( 78.9 % 83.7 % study period vs. 72.8 % 76.8 % ) . male le likely female receive antidepressant ( adjusted prevalence ratio ( apr ) : 0.83 ; 99 % confidence interval ( ci ) : 0.82–0.85 ) anxiolytic ( apr : 0.86 ; 99 % ci : 0.84–0.88 ) , whereas higher exposure antipsychotic ( apr : 1.04 ; 99 % ci : 1.02–1.06 ) adhd medication ( apr : 1.14 ; 99 % ci : 1.07–1.2 ) . age-specific trend showed increased adhd medication use among younger patient ( 14–24 year ) , anxiolytic use predominated aged ≥ 65 year . conclusion psychotropic medication use high among cluster b pd patient , difference medication class according age sex . marked sex age difference psychotropic medication use among cluster b pd patient underscore need sex-sensitive age-specific approach psychiatric care .

title: Social network reductions are associated with negative symptoms in schizophrenia
abstract: background recent environmental system theory negative symptom schizophrenia ( sz ) proposes role reduction social network exist within microsystems ( i.e . , context social interaction occur ) . however , unclear aspect social network impacted sz whether differentially associated specific domain negative symptom . current study aimed address gap literature using novel social network tool combination ecological momentary assessment ( ema ) clinical rating negative symptom . method participant included 40 outpatient diagnosed sz 35 demographically matched healthy control ( cn ) completed sociogram , brief negative symptom scale ( bns ) , 7 day ema survey assessing anhedonia , avolition , asociality . anova examined group difference social network characteristic . correlation examined association social network characteristic negative symptom measured via bns ema . result result indicated : ( 1 ) sz greater social network reduction cn , including lower : network density , number microsystems , people microsystems , connection across within microsystems ( p ’ < 0.05 , d-value range 0.58 0.74 ) ; ( 2 ) social network reduction associated greater severity negative symptom bns ( r range − 0.28–0.34 , p < .05 ) asociality measured via ema survey ( r ’ = − 0.24 − 0.26 , p ’ < 0.05 ) . conclusion finding clarified nature social network dysfunction sz identify novel target psychosocial intervention focused modifying number social microsystems connection within/across microsystems .

title: What kind of lived experience knowledge is the right kind? A reflective commentary
Shared decision-making in the treatment of bipolar disorder: findings from a nationwide naturalistic cohort study in everyday clinical practice
abstract: background shared decision-making ( sdm ) increasing importance mental health care , however , large study effect sdm bipolar disorder ( bd ) scarce . aim gain insight relationship sdm , guideline concordance treatment everyday practice , satisfaction care , medication adherence bd . method nationwide observational study treatment bd , patient asked question involvement treatment . question clustered according three-talk model ( ttm ) sdm , involves team talk , option talk , decision talk . composite concordance score multimodal treatment made , satisfaction care ( score 1 10 ) medication adherence ( dai-10 ) measured . result 839 patient bd various outpatient treatment center included . patient highly involved decision-making . multiple regression , team talk significantly positively associated guideline concordance ( b = 5.10 , p = .045 ) , decision talk positively associated satisfaction care ( b = 0.82 , p < .001 ) medication adherence ( b = 1.18 , p = .003 ) . conclusion positive association found sdm , guideline concordance , satisfaction care , medication adherence , suggesting investing step decision-making process together patient significant others , help improve quality care .

title: Predicting incident cardio-metabolic disease among persons with and without depressive and anxiety disorders: a machine learning approach
abstract: purpose global increase cardiovascular disease diabetes ( cardio-metabolic disease : cmd ) . suffering depression anxiety disorder increase probability developing cmd . study tested wide array predictor onset cmd machine learning ( ml ) , evaluating whether adding detailed psychiatric biological variable increase predictive performance . method analysed data netherlands study depression anxiety , longitudinal cohort study ( n = 2071 ) , using 368 predictor covering 4 domain ( demographic , lifestyle & somatic , psychiatric , biological marker ) . cmd onset ( 24 % incidence ) 9-year follow-up defined using self-reported stroke , heart disease , diabetes high fasting glucose level ( antithrombotic , cardiovascular , diabetes ) medication use ( atc code c01da , c01-c05a-b , c07-c09a-b , c01db , b01 , a10a-x ) . using different ml method ( logistic regression , support vector machine , random forest , xgboost ) tested predictive performance single domain domain combination . result classifier performed similarly , therefore simplest classifier ( logistic regression ) selected . area receiver operator characteristic curve ( auc-roc ) achieved singe domain ranged 0.569 0.649. combination demographic , lifestyle & somatic indicator psychiatric variable performed best ( auc-roc = 0.669 ) , significantly outperform demographic . age hypertension contributed prediction ; detailed psychiatric variable added relatively little . conclusion longitudinal study , ml classifier able accurately predict 9-year cmd onset sample enriched subject psychopathology . detailed psychiatric/biological information substantially increase predictive performance .

title: Screen time and manic symptoms in early adolescents: prospective findings from the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development Study
abstract: purpose study aimed examine prospective association screen time manic symptom early adolescent , extent problematic screen use ( characterized addiction , conflict , relapse , withdrawal ) mediates association . method analyzed prospective cohort data adolescent brain cognitive development study ( n = 9,243 ; age 10–11 year year 1 2017–2019 ; 48.8 % female ; 44.0 % racial/ethnic minority ) . participant reported daily time spent six different screen subtypes . linear regression analysis used determine association typical daily screen time ( year 1 ; total subtypes ) manic symptom ( year 3 , 7 mania scale ) , adjusting potential confounders . sleep duration , problematic social medium use , problematic video game use ( year 2 ) tested potential mediator . result adjusting covariates , overall typical daily screen time year 1 prospectively associated higher manic symptom year 3 ( b = 0.05 , 95 % ci 0.03 , 0.07 , p < 0.001 ) , four subtypes : social medium ( b = 0.20 , 95 % ci 0.09 , 0.32 , p = 0.001 ) , texting ( b = 0.18 , 95 % ci 0.08 , 0.28 , p < 0.001 ) , video ( b = 0.14 , 95 % ci 0.08 , 0.19 , p < 0.001 ) , video game ( b = 0.09 , 95 % ci 0.04 , 0.14 , p = 0.001 ) . problematic social medium use , video game use , sleep duration year 2 found significant partial mediator ( 47.7 % , 58.0 % , 9.0 % mediation , respectively ) . conclusion result indicate significant prospective relationship screen time manic symptom early adolescence highlight problematic screen use , video game use , sleep duration potential mediator . problematic screen use may target mental health prevention early intervention effort among adolescent .

title: The impact of affective and negative symptoms on the development of psychosis in a six-year follow-up of a community-based population
abstract: purpose clinical high risk ( chr ) concept limited transition risk psychotic disorder ( pd ) . study investigates association affective negative symptom , currently included chr concept , risk transition pd community-based population 2185 participant turkey . method participant assessed twice six year using multistage sampling technique . two separate linear regression analysis conducted data assessment , investigating relationship affective negative symptom , subclinical clinical psychotic experience ( pe ) progression pd . result overall transition rate pd 1.3 % . analysis showed increased risk developing pd 'subclinical pe ' group follow-up , compared 'no pe ' group . however , classified 'clinical pe ' ( : 6.23 ; p = 0.010 ) 'clinical pe + affective/negative symptom ' ( : 8.48 ; p = 0.001 ) baseline associated increased risk developing pd follow-up . presence 'affective/negative symptom ' baseline associated increased risk incident subclinical pe ( rr : 1.98 ; p = 0.001 ) , incident clinical pe ( rr : 3.14 ; p = 0.001 ) , incident pd ( rr : 4.21 ; p = 0.030 ) follow-up . conclusion result confirm significance baseline severity positive symptom predicting transition pd suggest positive affective/negative symptom impact transition risk pd incident psychotic symptom . highlight potential utility defining chr group based combination positive , affective , negative symptom .

title: Clarifying the relationship between insecure attachment and problematic social media use across platforms: a network analysis
abstract: background despite evidence suggesting insecure attachment significant risk factor problematic social medium use ( psmu ) , remains lack comprehensive study exploring relationship , unified understanding role yet established . method employed network analysis construct integrated model examining complex interrelation negative emotion , trait state attachment , motif , psmu across three platform ( i.e . , wechat , sina weibo , tiktok ) , well identifying potential mediating variable attachment psmu . data collected 685 young adult via online self-reported questionnaire . result found negative emotion positively correlated insecure trait state attachment negligible direct relationship psmu . conformity motive state attachment security emerged important central node measured strength , closeness , betweenness . moreover , attachment state motif found clustered . strong interrelationship also evident insecure attachment psmu , trait attachment anxiety avoidance observed related psmu across various platform . conclusion finding promote deeper understanding relationship insecure attachment psmu cross-platform perspective offer novel insight mechanism underlying co-occurrence , may guide development effective intervention healthier social medium engagement .

title: Decomposing the association of psychosocial wellbeing with all-cause mortality: the mediating role of physical health and lifestyle factors
abstract: purpose study quantified effect 48 psychosocial construct all-cause mortality using data 7,698 individual u.s. health retirement study . method latent class analysis used divide participant mutually exclusive psychosocial wellbeing group ( good , average , poor ) subsequently considered exposure . mediation analysis conducted determine direct effect psychosocial wellbeing group indirect ( mediating ) effect physical health ( functional status comorbid condition ) lifestyle factor ( physical activity , smoking , alcohol consumption ) overall survival . also created composite health index measure representing summative effect mediator . result observed strong statistically significant total effect ( te ) survival time psychosocial wellbeing group ( survival time ratio ( sr ) = 1.73 , 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) :1.50,2.01 comparing good poor ) . mediation analysis revealed direct effect via psychosocial wellbeing group accounted half te ( sr = 1.46 , 95 % ci:1.27,1.67 ) . composite health index measure mediated 36.2 % te natural indirect effect sr 1.18 ( 95 % ci:1.13,1.22 ) . conclusion finding demonstrate interconnectedness psychosocial wellbeing physical health lifestyle factor survival .

title: Barriers and facilitators to accessing sexual and reproductive health services for people with severe mental illness: a systematic review
abstract: purpose despite increased prevalence sexual reproductive health problem among people severe mental illness ( smi ) , uptake sexual reproductive healthcare group poor . reason unclear . therefore , review aimed identify barrier facilitator accessing sexual reproductive health service service user perspective . method three electronic database searched using key word “ sexual health ” “ smi ” . data screened extracted two independent reviewer . joanna briggs institute critical appraisal tool used quality included study . result five study included underwent narrative synthesis . access hiv care ( n2 ) , access family planning method ( n2 ) access general sexual healthcare ( n1 ) . barrier relating hiv care included cost ; barrier relating family planning included lack awareness considering issue ; barrier general sexual healthcare included psychotic symptom , mental health prioritisation , stigma , lack sexual health focus mental health program , difficulty initiating conversation , knowledge , culture/religion/ethnicity , finance . conclusion study examined access hiv family planning service way limited participant response . one study examined barrier facilitator accessing generic sexual health service , robustly , although focussed solely young woman provided limited data facilitator . future work focus examining barrier , facilitator , accessing sexual healthcare people smi better identify address challenge . prospero id crd42023414740 .

title: Psychological symptoms and loneliness in unemployed people diagnosed with mental illnesses
abstract: purpose loneliness pervasive phenomenon linked adverse health outcome . unemployed individual mental illness ( umis ) constitute high-risk group , substantial implication health vocational ( ) integration . study aim gain deeper insight relationship psychological problem symptom psychopathology loneliness umis . method research based sample lipsy , project aim maintain restore employability . two regression analysis conducted sample unemployed participant diagnosed mental illness ( icd-10 : f-code ) outcome variable loneliness ( ucla ) . first analysis , age , gender , education , cohabitation status , social network size ( lsns-6 ) used predictor ; second one , nine symptom dimension ( scl-90 ) - ( 1 ) somatization , ( 2 ) obsessive-compulsive , ( 3 ) interpersonal sensitivity , ( 4 ) depression , ( 5 ) anxiety , ( 6 ) anger-hostility , ( 7 ) phobic anxiety , ( 8 ) paranoid ideation , ( 9 ) psychoticism -were added . result sample included 397 participant average age 35.8 year , 53.1 % female . final regression showed significant positive association higher level education , interpersonal sensitivity , depression , outcome loneliness , significant negative relationship somatization loneliness . conclusion high score scl-90 dimension , link identified somatization , interpersonal sensitivity , depression , loneliness highlight importance psychological screening and/or diagnostics high-risk group offer several starting point prevention measure well intervention .

title: Assessing personal recovery in individuals with severe mental illness: validation of the Dutch Brief INSPIRE-O
abstract: purpose recovery key objective mental health service people severe mental illness ( smi ) . addition clinical functional recovery , personal recovery gained increasing attention . chime framework identifies five personal recovery processes—connectedness , hope , identity , meaning , empowerment—and theoretical foundation brief inspire , validated patient-rated experience measure ( prem ) evaluate recovery support . brief inspire modified five-item patient-rated outcome measure ( prom ) assessing recovery , called brief inspire-outcome ( brief inspire-o ) . subject study psychometric property brief inspire-o . method data validity reliability gathered annual routine outcome monitoring collected 861 individual smi flexible assertive community treatment team follow-up measurement available 232 individual . test–retest reliability evaluated separate subset 30 individual smi . result brief inspire-o show good internal consistency ( cronbach ’ alpha 0.77 ) , test–retest reliability , construct validity , sensitivity change floor ceiling effect . furthermore , change brief inspire-o positively related change quality life negatively problem clinical functioning unmet care need . conclusion brief inspire-o used research monitoring better understand improve process personal recovery individual smi .

title: The impact of recreational cannabis legalization on cannabis-related acute care events among adults with schizophrenia
abstract: purpose patient schizophrenia higher risk cannabis use disorder may uniquely affected legalization recreational cannabis . study examined whether cannabis legalization led change acute care utilization among patient schizophrenia . method using linked health administrative data , included adult patient schizophrenia ontario october 2015 may 2021 ( n = 121,061 ) . examined difference cannabis , psychosis , mental health-related emergency department ( ed ) visit three period : pre-legalization , legalization flower herb ( phase 1 ) , legalization edible , extract , topicals ( phase 2 ) using interrupted time-series method . result study found phase 1 associated decrease cannabis-related , mental health-related , cannabis + psychosis-related ed visit among patient schizophrenia . notably , immediate 25.8 % ( 95 % ci 13.8–37.6 % ) decrease cannabis-related ed visit observed men , immediate 18.5 % decrease mental health-related ed visit ( 95 % ci 6.0–31.2 % ) woman . decrease also shown comparative model , demonstrating change observed distinct trend general population . however , phase 2 associated significant change . conclusion despite higher baseline rate acute care utilization among patient schizophrenia , cannabis legalization associated significant reduction , particularly phase 1. finding suggest regulatory measure accompanying legalization could enhance quality safety cannabis product , potentially leading fewer adverse health outcome vulnerable patient population . research needed optimize healthcare response vulnerable population .

title: Trajectories of work disability and unemployment before and after a common mental disorder diagnosis among young private sector employees in Sweden–a register-based longitudinal study
abstract: purpose identify trajectory group work disability ( wd ) , including sick leave disability pension , unemployment three year six year ( y-3 + 6 ) common mental disorder ( cmd ) diagnosis investigate association socio-demographic , work-related clinical factor trajectory membership . method longitudinal nationwide register-based study conducted including individual aged 22–29 year , gainfully employed private sector , cmd diagnosis specialised healthcare prescribed antidepressant ( n = 12,121 ) 2014 ( year 0/y0 ) , follow-up y-3 + 6. group-based trajectory analysis identified group individual followed similar trajectory month wd unemployment , respectively . multinomial logistic regression determined association socio-demographic , work-related clinical factor trajectory membership . result cmd group , identified three trajectory group , wd unemployment . 7 % individual belonged ‘ fluctuant high ’ trajectory group four month wd y0 , peaked 7 month + 3 reduced 5 month + 6. unemployment , 15 % belonged ‘ increasing medium ’ trajectory group steadily increased 1.3 month y0 2.6 month + 6. sex , educational level musculoskeletal disorder wd , educational level , living area occupational class unemployment , influentially determined variance across cmd trajectory group . conclusion specific vulnerable group regarding unfavourable wd ( woman , low education musculoskeletal disorder ) unemployment ( manual work , low education rural residence ) trajectory require special attention regarding return-to-work process following cmd diagnosis .

title: Interventions supporting meaningful connections for people with serious mental illness: a concept-framed systematic narrative review
abstract: purpose meaningful connection , encompassing relationship providing emotional support , understanding , acceptance , sense belonging , vital social inclusion well-being individual serious mental illness ( smi ) . mixed method review critically explored multifaceted approach supporting people smi foster meaningful ( non-intimate ) social relationship connection . method search eight electronic database returned 4882 record . duplicate removal , title abstract , full-text , screening hand searching resulted 23 record inclusion . study integrated using civic framework emphasising importance closeness , identity , valued relationship , involvement , feeling cared accepted . result review identified emotional physical challenge , societal stigma , environmental factor hinder making meaningful connection . study highlighted necessity intervention adaptable , personalised , encompassing structured activity , peer professional support , technology-assisted platform . conclusion complexity social interaction smi call comprehensive , holistic strategy nurture social relationship within community .

title: Exploring the tipping point: a qualitative study of labour marked experiences among young people with first episode of schizophrenia
abstract: purpose work hold significant value life individual , impacting various aspect identity , health , economy . however , young individual schizophrenia often encounter challenge accessing maintaining employment . despite , knowledge regarding experience labor market sparse . study aimed explore perspective labor market affiliation vocational intervention relation quality life health among young people schizophrenia . method qualitative approach employed , applying individual interview data collection method . twelve patient first episode schizophrenia recruited two outpatient clinic . thematic analysis used , following inductive process . user panel established ensure quality relevance study . result three key theme identified analysis : 1 . “ work simultaneously rewarding demanding ” , highlighting struggle balance benefit employment difficulty meeting labor market requirement ; 2 . “ mental health , stigma work : complex interplay ” , concerned work simultaneously contributes stress reduces psychiatric symptom ; 3 . “ supported employment : facilitating work-life balance ” , concerning supported employment intervention facilitated better work-life balance , enhancing overall quality life , specific condition . conclusion young individual schizophrenia highly motivated work , yet encounter significant barrier labour market participation , related mental health condition societal stigma . supported employment programme emerge crucial empowering individual schizophrenia navigate complexity labour market managing mental health effectively .

title: Universal credit trajectories among individuals who access secondary mental health services: analysis of linked data
abstract: purpose examine universal credit ( uc ) trajectory , transition uc conditionality regime among secondary care mental health service user . sociodemographic diagnostic characteristic associated uc trajectory explored . method mental health record data 4876 individual attended mental health service linked administrative benefit data . entry cohort created including mental health service user received uc 2016 followed 4.5 year . sequence analysis used , followed cluster analysis identify typical uc trajectory . sociodemographic diagnostic characteristic associated uc cluster explored using multinominal logistic regression ; result presented average marginal effect . result six distinct uc cluster identified . cluster indicated : short-term uc searching work ( 18.7 % ) , medium-term uc searching work ( 19.1 % ) , long-term uc searching work ( 21.4 % ) , work requirement ( 11.9 % ) , uc working cluster ( 6.1 % ) , work searching caring responsibility cluster ( 22.8 % ) . woman overrepresented medium-term uc searching work cluster whereas older people likely long-term uc searching work work requirement cluster . diagnosed severe mental illness overrepresented work requirement group . conclusion trajectory dominated required search work albeit different time period exiting uc . one ten people assessed unable work extended period . finding used inform support people mental health problem vulnerable conditionality longer-term uc receipt .

title: Individual, intergenerational, and contextual factors associated with coping strategies, coping variability, and perceived coping efficacy among young adults
abstract: purpose stress-related coping important mechanism mental health functioning . however , distribution coping process across various factor ( e.g . , individual like sex , contextual like perceived social status ) remain under-explored . study identified individual , intergenerational , contextual factor associated coping strategy , variability use ( proxy using strategy flexibly across context ) , perceived coping efficacy handle stressor among young adult . method participant nicotine dependence teen study ( ndit ; n = 827 ) completed validated coping inventory stressful situation scale 2011–12 ( age ~ 24 ) . data many factor , including race/ethnicity , intergenerational education pattern , perceived social status , collected 1999–2000 ( ndit inception ; age 12–13 ) 2011–12 . linear multinominal regression modeled association individual , intergenerational , contextual factor coping strategy , variability , efficacy , separately . result woman versus men reported frequent use emotion- , distraction- , social diversion-oriented strategy higher variability level ( e.g . , b_emotion=0.40 , 95 % ci = 0.28 , 0.51 ) , le frequent use task-oriented strategy lower coping efficacy ( e.g . , b_efficacy=-0.46 , 95 % ci=-0.59 , -0.32 ) . higher income , educated mother , higher perceived social status community associated frequent use task-oriented strategy coping efficacy , le frequent use emotion-oriented strategy . factor , including race/ethnicity , marital status , school socio-economic status , robustly related coping process . conclusion finding document distribution coping process across individual , intergenerational , contextual factor among young adult , may broadly increase understanding social disparity mental health .

title: The RECAPACITA PROJECT: comparative study of the clinical, neuropsychological, and functional profile of people with severe mental disorder and partial and total capacity modification

title: Prevalence and determinants of orthorexia nervosa among Turkish adolescents
abstract: purpose given prevalence diversity eating issue among adolescent , understanding epidemiological aspect orthorexia nervosa ( ) demographic , along identifying associated clinical factor , sociodemographic trait , eating habit parental attitude , hold paramount importance clinically scientifically . study aimed ascertain prevalence among turkish high school adolescent aged 14–18 explore potential correlate clinical condition . method initial phase , 1784 adolescent completed data form , orthorexia nervosa inventory ( oni ) parent style scale ( p ) , parent filled parental version revised child anxiety depression scale ( rcads ) . subsequently , clinical interview kiddie-schedule affective disorder schizophrenia school aged child , present lifetime version ( kd-sads-pl ) conducted 9 adolescent high risk comorbidities . result study revealed prevalence 0.5 % , 0.3 % boy 0.6 % girl . rural residency , dietary supplement use , pet ownership correlated higher oni score ( p = 0.022 , p = 0.002 , p = 0.042 respectively ) . ocd panic disorder symptom ( b = 0.307 , p < 0.001 b = 0.165 , p = 0.018 respectively ) , increased bmi , anxiety score associated elevated oni score . authoritarian parenting significantly related oni total score ( b = 1.69 , p = 0.018 ) . conclusion study significantly contributes literature delineating prevalence adolescent , identifying associated risk factor , elucidating psychopathological association orthorexic symptom , identifying relationship parenting style . insight factor influencing aid demystifying nature .

title: Trends in psychotropic medication across occupation types before and during the Covid-19 pandemic: a linked administrative data study
abstract: purpose using linked administrative data , study provides first longitudinal analysis mental health among worker across occupational group prior covid-19 pandemic . eleven year data analysed examine whether pandemic period coincided change psychotropic medication worker across broad occupational grouping . method data northern ireland ( ni ) enhanced prescribing database ( epd ) linked ni longitudinal study ( nil ) examine trend anti-depressants , anxiolytic hypnotic ( 2011–2021 ) among ni worker ( n = 200,004 ) across nine major occupation group . quarterly prescription examined prior pandemic restriction ( q1-2011 q4-2019 ; q1-2020 q4-2021 , respectively ) . auto-regressive integrated moving average ( arima ) model trained compare ‘ forecasted ’ ‘ observed ’ rate pandemic period , stratified occupational group . result q2-2020 coincided lower-than-expected receipt anxiolytic anti-depressants several broad occupation type . receipt anxiolytic prescription among manager , directors/senior official dropped expected level three quarter q3-2020 q1-2021 . finally , notable increase anti-depressants prolonged period found among staff caring/leisure related profession , well higher rate hypnotic q2-2021 . conclusion study provides first longitudinal examination variation mental health across occupation type prior covid-19 pandemic , using available linked administrative data . finding suggest occupation type important pandemic-related stressor point potential higher risk occupation could focus targeted intervention future pandemic .

title: Sex differences in lifetime suicide attempts in retired older adults between 2000 and 2021 in France: results from six national surveys

title: Conceptualising workplace loneliness: a qualitative investigation with UK workers
abstract: purpose loneliness identified important risk factor mental health problem , concern impact worker ’ health wellbeing grown recent year . body workplace loneliness research emerging , degree existing definition phenomenon reflect worker ’ experience investigated . study aim develop evidence-based conceptualisation workplace loneliness inform future research intervention aiming improve worker ’ mental health wellbeing . method semi-structured interview exploring experience social connection , loneliness work conducted diverse sample 31 uk-based worker . interview supplemented social mapping task . interview data analysed inductively using reflexive thematic analysis . social map analysed using thematic analysis approach informed visual semiology framework . result three theme identified , loneliness conceptualised disconnection ( 1 ) colleague , ( 2 ) one ’ organisation , ( 3 ) society . across theme , disconnection loneliness experienced unfulfilled desire feel one ’ authentic self understood , valued belonged result one ’ work occupation . conclusion workplace loneliness comprises dissatisfaction interpersonal relationship work , also sense disconnection larger social group structure , particularly one ’ employing organisation society whole . definition workplace loneliness acknowledge role social organisational context , well professional relationship , needed better reflect lived experience loneliness work .

title: Income inequality and deaths of despair: a population-based study of 19 million Canadian adults
abstract: purpose estimate association regional level income inequality ( relative measure socioeconomic disparity ) death despair whether association moderated age , gender , racialized minority status , income . method data 2006 canadian census health environment cohort ( canchec ) study used . cohort canadian adult ( n = 19,436,790 ) within 288 cd followed may 2006 december 2019. multilevel cox-proportional hazard regression used estimate association income inequality time death attributed suicide , drug overdose , alcohol . result model adjusted confounders , income inequality associated time death due alcohol ( hr = 1.14 ; 95 % ci : 1.05 , 1.25 ) , drug overdose ( hr = 1.19 ; 95 % ci : 1.06 , 1.33 ) , death despair ( hr = 1.05 ; 95 % ci : 1.00 , 1.11 ) . significant interaction primarily observed case death attributed drug overdose . association income inequality hazard drug overdose death stronger individual aged 40–49 ( hr = 1.71 ; 95 % ci : 1.24 , 2.37 ) , male ( hr = 1.69 ; 95 % ci : 1.22 , 2.35 ) , low-income household ( hr = 1.69 ; 95 % ci : 1.22 , 2.35 ) , self identified white ( hr = 1.69 ; 95 % ci : 1.22 , 2.35 ) living low-income area ( hr = 1.69 ; 95 % ci : 1.22 , 2.35 ) . conclusion income inequality associated high risk death despair . additionally , association significantly moderated age , gender , racialized minority status income household area level . , finding suggest need address income inequality intervention reducing death despair among canadian adult .

title: Are Big Five personality traits associated with trajectories of depressive symptom among middle-aged and older adults in China?
abstract: background personality trait confirmed associated mental health , influence trajectory depressive symptom among middle-aged older adult china well understood . study seek identify distinct trajectory depressive symptom explore relationship big five personality trait china . method data collected china family panel study ( cfps ) 2016 , 2018 , 2020 , 2012 used study . 5376 individual aged 45 older included study . latent growth mixture modeling applied identify distinct trajectory depressive symptom , multinomial logistic regression used examine association personality trait trajectory . result three depressive symptom trajectory identified : stable increasing low starting point ( 53.18 % ) , descending type high starting point ( 8.03 % ) , stable middle level ( 38.78 % ) . higher extraversion score associated lower depressive symptom trajectory , higher level openness neuroticism associated increased risk severe depressive symptom trajectory . heterogeneity analysis revealed , among individual aged 45–60 , conscientiousness negatively associated depressive symptom , openness positively related depression . among older adult ( ≥ 60 year ) , extraversion showed strongest protective effect depressive symptom , higher openness demonstrated notably stronger association depression . additionally , female showed stronger association personality trait depressive symptom male . conclusion different trajectory depressive symptom observed among middle-aged older adult china . finding underscore importance tailored mental health monitoring , distinct approach needed different gender age group .

abstract: purpose exposure traumatic event may lead development acute stress disorder ( asd ) within first month post-trauma individual , others may exhibit asd symptom . asd introduced potential early indicator identify higher risk developing posttraumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) , however , ptsd occur individual even without prior asd . assessing asd post-trauma assist identifying would benefit intervention prevent later ptsd , yet predictive power asd varies across study , intensity asd symptom subthreshold ptsd often le considered . method prospective cohort study 426 health worker exposed beirut port blast assessed dsm-5 asd symptom intensity using self-report questionnaire two distinct time point : 9–15 21–27 day post blast . dsm-5 ptsd assessed afterwards 6–7 month via self-report questionnaire post-exposure . probit model predicted full subthreshold ptsd . result using asd diagnosis alone , sensitivity 9–15 day trauma better 21–27 day trauma ( 75.68 % vs. 58.06 % ) ; stratified intensity , however , sensitivity increased 41.66 % among low intensity 92 % among high intensity . specificity , however , better 21–27 day trauma ( 77.82 % ) compared 9–15 day ( 60.98 % ) . positive predictive value asd increased , negative predictive value decreased , time since exposure adding intensity diagnosis . asd diagnosis plus intensity achieved better prediction ptsd subthreshold ptsd . conclusion screening ptsd include asd intensity , improving predictive ability later ptsd , incorporatingfull threshold subthreshold ptsd . specificity increase time since exposure , suggesting high rate false positive assessing asd soon trauma . highlight need prioritize individual early preventive measure trauma .
