abstract: purpose epidemiological study investigating mental health impact microaggressions trans population tended methodological limitation , including lack validated measure , raising concern validity finding . address evidence gap , investigated association microaggressions poor mental health ( depression ; anxiety ; non-suicidal self-harm [ nssh ] ; suicidal thought ; suicide attempt ) amongst trans people . method conducted cross-sectional survey 787 trans adult uk , measuring mental health exposure microaggressions using gender identity microaggressions scale ( gims ) . using univariable multivariable linear logistic regression model tested association microaggressions depressive symptom ( phq-9 ) , anxiety symptom ( gad-7 ) , lifetime nssh , lifetime suicidal thought , lifetime suicide attempt . result 787 participant , 574 ( 73 % ) provided complete data . microaggressions common experience , affecting 97.6 % participant lifetime . adjusted analysis , using sociodemographic clinical variable , increased microaggression score associated increased depressive symptom ( adjusted coefficient : 1.86 ( 95 % ci = 1.35 2.36 ) ) , anxiety symptom ( adjusted coefficient : 1.57 ( 95 % ci = 1.09 –2.05 ) ) increased odds nssh ( odds ratio [ ] _ adj 1.83 ( 95 % ci = 1.45 –2.30 ) ) , suicidal thought ( or_adj 2.18 , ( 95 % ci = 1.52 –3.13 ) ) , suicide attempt ( or_adj , 1.59 , ( 95 % ci = 1.32 –1.92 ) ) . exploratory analysis different gims subscales associated various outcome . conclusion evidence association microaggressions adverse mental health outcome , well support specific microaggressions associated specific outcome , emphasizing importance public health intervention target microaggressions directed trans adult . longitudinal study needed investigate temporality association microaggressions mental health outcome .

title: Return to work after sick leave due to mental illness - a qualitative study on the perspective of workplace integration managers
abstract: background aim increasing number people unable work due mental illness increasing problem personal societal level . germany , workplace integration management system ( bem ) legally required since 2004 support return work ( rtw ) . however , uptake success , especially regarding mental illness , still unclear . study conducted identify current state rtw episode mental illness perspective workplace integration manager explore potential barrier facilitator influence course outcome bem process . method semi-structured interview bem manager ( n = 14 ) greater munich area performed analyzed using thematic analysis . result work , bem manager tend find field tension personal concern returning employee employer ’ business interest . experience mistrust lack openness part returnees , employer show little willingness fully invest process . lack incorrect information bem mental illness seems promote disruptive factor , well others . conclusion broad education bem appears promising mean reduce fear among returnees better reach process potential . addition , open approach mental illness could simplify process involved .

title: The victimisation experience schedule: contextualising interpersonal trauma and perceived discrimination in individuals with psychotic experiences with and without a need-for-care
abstract: purpose victimisation associated psychotic experience ( pe ) across psychosis continuum , yet contextual factor possibly influencing outcome neglected . building unusual experience enquiry study ( unique ) showing higher childhood trauma lower discrimination individual pe without need-for-care , compared need-for-care , study utilized novel instrument examine victimisation-related contextual factor . method individual unique study persistent pe ( clinical , n = 82 ) without ( non-clinical , n = 92 ) need-for-care , control group without pe ( n = 83 ) , completed victimisation experience schedule ( f ) . multidimensional instrument , comprising item validated measure , interpersonal trauma discriminatory experience , alongside contextual factor : impact , powerlessness , social support , age , duration , frequency , victim-perpetrator relationship , reason discrimination . result difference lifetime interpersonal trauma clinical non-clinical group , latter reporting slightly control . clinical group experienced lifetime perceived discrimination group . difference emerged impact powerlessness time victimisation ; however , clinical group reported lower positive social support higher current impact powerlessness type victimisation . discrimination occurred earlier lasted longer clinical group group , often attributed mental health race/ethnicity , likely reflecting higher proportion racially minoritized individual . conclusion result suggest interplay risk protective factor around victimisation may shape outcome , highlighting importance assessing contextual factor victimisation using comprehensive tool like f .

title: Trends in alcohol use disorder symptoms among U.S. adults disaggregated by sex, race, and age
abstract: purpose population-based study alcohol-related trend typically collapse across sex examining race and/or age , limiting understanding shift alcohol involvement intersection sex , race , age . therefore , study evaluated population-level trend alcohol use alcohol use disorder ( aud ) symptom disaggregated within hispanic , black , white female male u.s. early middle adult . method data year 2002 2019 national survey drug use health , participant 18 64 , hispanic , black , white , consumed alcohol . annualized linear change estimate computed trend past-month drinking day aud symptom . group analysis also conducted examine ( ) sex difference within ethnoracial identity ( b ) ethnoracial difference within sex . analysis stratified across early ( age 18 29 ) middle adult ( age 30 64 ) . result number drinking day increased among black early adult female black middle adult female decreased male except black middle adult , strongest decrease black early adult male . aud symptom decreased early adult male , strongly among black male . among middle adult , aud symptom decreased among hispanic male increased among white male female . conclusion relevance national trend alcohol use aud symptom distinct across subpopulation intersection sex , race , age . continued disaggregated analysis across heterogeneous u.s. subpopulation needed better inform clinical care .

title: Can primary mental health services impact levels of involuntary admissions? A cluster-RCT of the ReCoN intervention
abstract: purpose internationally , policy legal change seek reduce use involuntary psychiatric admission . usually directed towards specialist service , initiative show little sustained progress . tested whether intervention level primary mental health service potential reduce use involuntary admission . method conducted two-arm cluster-rct following zelen ’ design ( clinicaltrials.gov : nct03989765 ) . cluster included primary mental health service local collaborator mid-sized norwegian municipality rate involuntary admission national average . five cluster randomised co-create implement comprehensive intervention . could blinded , five control cluster . primary hypothesis rate involuntary admission would lower intervention arm comparing change time arm , would sustain . secondary hypothesis rate referral involuntary admission rate referral confirmed involuntary status second statutory assessment , would lower intervention arm . result data obtained norwegian patient registry included event study period . difference trial arm change rate involuntary admission baseline intervention period 6.8 ( 95 % ci 1.8 11.7 ; effect size ( ec ) 2.7 ) , reduced 3.0 ( 95 % ci -3.8 9.7 ; e 0.9 ) baseline post-intervention period . difference arm regarding change referral rate baseline intervention period 1.7 ( 95 % ci -4.6 8.1 ; e 0.5 ) , change rate referral resulting involuntary status 1.3 ( 95 % ci -3.4 6.0 ; e 0.8 ) . conclusion found clear difference trial arm primary outcome involuntary admission intervention period , beyond period , regarding referral involuntary admission , although consistent direction change favoured intervention . interpret result constitute ‘ proof concept ’ adequately resourced primary mental health service might contribute policy aim reducing involuntary care . rigorous study heterogeneous context required .

title: Interactions between early-life adversity, pandemic stress, and social support on psychiatric disorders in a nationally representative sample of Canadian adults
abstract: purpose study examined pre-existing early-life adversity ( ela ) current social support interacted covid-specific pandemic stressor relation risk psychiatric disorder nationally-representative sample canadian adult . method participant ( n = 9,409 ) mental health access care survey , cross-sectional survey canadian adult later stage covid pandemic ( march july 2022 ) . measure included pandemic stressor ( statistic canada ) , ela ( childhood experience violence questionnaire ) , social support ( social provision scale ) , past 12-month psychiatric problem ( who-cidi ) . statistical analysis included two-step logistic regression model adjusted covariates weighted complex survey design . result higher odds psychiatric problem predicted ela ( aor = 1.24 [ 1.15–1.35 ] -aor = 1.53 [ 1.39–1.69 ] across psychiatric disorder ) pandemic stress ( aor = 1.18 [ 1.12–1.25 ] -aor = 1.32 [ 1.26–1.39 ] across psychiatric disorder ) . significant interaction ela pandemic stress depression ( aor = 0.96 [ 0.93–0.98 ] ) suggested attenuated effect pandemic stress higher level ela . social support associated reduced psychiatric problem ( aor = 0.88 [ 0.86–0.91 ] -aor = 0.97 [ 0.94–0.99 ] ) , pandemic stress associated increased psychiatric problem ( aor = 1.20 [ 1.15–1.26 ] -aor = 1.33 [ 1.27–1.40 ] ) . interaction social support pandemic stress suicidality ( aor = 1.02 [ 1.01–1.03 ] ) indicated higher level social support associated increased odds suicidality presence pandemic stress , though effect small questionable clinical significance . conclusion ela pandemic stress increased psychiatric disorder likelihood , social support protective . however , interaction indicate nuanced relationship mental health risk pandemic .

title: Psychiatric disorders following the clustering of family disadvantages in previous generations: a multigenerational cohort study
abstract: purpose lack multigenerational research extent mental health informed transmission multiple disadvantage across previous generation . study aim investigate family socioeconomic psychosocial disadvantage cluster transition grandparental parental generation , might associated grandchild psychiatric disorder . method utilized cohort study data following three generation stockholm birth cohort multigenerational study , including 11,299 individual born 1953 ( parental generation ) , 22,598 parent ( grandparental generation ) , 24,707 adult child ( grandchild generation ) . family disadvantage exposure measured across two periods– grandparental adulthood ( parental childhood ) parental adulthood ( grandchild childhood ) , included socioeconomic ( i.e . , low income , non-employment , overcrowding , single parenthood ) psychosocial aspect ( i.e . , single parenthood , teenage motherhood , psychiatric disorder , criminality father ) . psychiatric disorder adult grandchild outcome defined hospitalization main contributing diagnosis reflecting mental behavioral disorder age 18 2019. result multiple disadvantage within grandparental parental generation , respectively , predicted higher probability grandchild psychiatric disorder . multigenerational transmission evident grandchild combination grandparental socioeconomic disadvantage parental psychosocial disadvantage comparably high probability psychiatric disorder . importantly , improved socioeconomic psychosocial circumstance across previous generation predicted comparably low probability grandchild psychiatric disorder . conclusion mental health future generation informed transmission multiple disadvantage across previous generation , transition grandparental socioeconomic disadvantage parental psychosocial disadvantage particularly important .

title: Combining family history and alcohol screening measures to identify emerging adults at risk of not being in education, employment, or training (NEET)
abstract: purpose outside labor education system young adulthood , status termed education , employment , training ( neet ) , risk factor later social health outcome . study examined whether parental substance use ( psu ) moderate relationship personal alcohol consumption neet . information may inform screening practice . method participant included 2,940 respondent ( 15–25-year-olds ) 2014 danish national survey . historical cohort study , survey data linked register data respondent ’ parent follow-up register data respondent ’ educational/employment status ( 2015–2018 ) . alcohol use disorder identification test-consumption ( audit-c ) identified respondent hazardous drinking . psu measured using survey register data . outcome identified neet 1 + year follow-up . analysis included gender stratified multivariable logistic regression . result survey-based psu associated higher odds neet ( = 1.67 , p < .001 ) . audit-c + survey psu interaction statistically significant female ( = 2.70 , p =.007 ) : audit-c + female survey psu higher odds neet audit-c + female without survey psu . result similar using register psu . gender , parental factor ( unemployment psychiatric problem ) also associated higher odds neet . conclusion using family history ( including unemployment , psychiatric problem , substance use ) may enhance screening identify emerging adult risk adverse social outcome . survey- register-based psu similarly associated neet , suggesting asking emerging adult parent ’ substance use may informative objective measure family risk .

title: Workplace and non-workplace loneliness: a cross-sectional comparative study on risk factors and impacts on absenteeism and mental health among employees in Spain
abstract: purpose aim study ( 1 ) evaluate prevalence concordance workplace non-workplace loneliness , ( 2 ) compare sociodemographic risk factor workplace non-workplace loneliness , ( 3 ) compare working conditions-related risk factor two context loneliness , ( 4 ) compare impact workplace non-workplace loneliness absenteeism , depression , anxiety substance use disorder . method sample employee residing spain ( n = 5400 ) surveyed using computer-assisted web interview ( cawi ) august september 2024. logistic regression model constructed compare effect risk factor workplace non-workplace loneliness ( including sociodemographic factor , factor related working condition ) , well association workplace non-workplace loneliness absenteeism , symptom depression , anxiety , substance use disorder . result among active worker , 40.7 % report experiencing workplace loneliness , 42.0 % report non-workplace loneliness . level concordance type loneliness low ( kappa = 0.36 ) . type prevalent among younger immigrant worker . sociodemographic risk factor ( female , non-married , non-heterosexual ) significantly associated non-workplace loneliness . meanwhile , risk factor related working condition -particularly working stress labor precariousness- associated type loneliness , showed independent impact absenteeism , depression , anxiety , substance use disorder . conclusion social determinant workplace loneliness rooted work environment , indicating effective intervention focus addressing labor condition precariousness improve workplace non-workplace loneliness impact absenteeism mental health .

title: Comparison of the prevalence of probably postpartum depression before and during the covid-19 pandemic in Turkey: a systematic review and meta-analysis
abstract: purpose determine prevalence probably postpartum depression effect covid-19 pandemic prevalence probably postpartum depression based result study turkey . method systematic review meta-analysis cross-sectional study . key word postpartum depression postnatal depression turkey searched electronic database pubmed , ebscohost , ovid journal , science direct , web science , ulakbim database , dergipark , tr dizin , yök-natural thesis centre . systematic review performed following prisma cosmos-e. data collected using data extraction tool developed researcher . quality study evaluated utilizing joanna briggs institute ’ critical appraisal checklist analytical cross sectional study . obtained data synthesized meta-analysis , narrative synthesis , subgroup analysis meta-regression . result total sample size 34 study included meta-analysis 10 236. cut-off score epds considered ≥ 13 30 study ≥ 12 four study . pooled probably postpartum depression prevalence 17.8 % ( 95 % ci : 0.153–0.206 ; 95 % prediction interval : 0.070–0.383 ) . found 16.3 % pandemic ( 95 % ci : 0.065–0.358 ; 95 % prediction interval : 0.065–0.358 ) increased 20.2 % pandemic ( 95 % ci : 0.068–0.468 ; 95 % prediction interval : 0.068–0.468 ) , though difference significant ( q = 1.77 ; df : 1 ; p = 0.184 ) . meta-regression analysis showed prevalence probably postpartum depression change depending geographical region study performed , time data collection cut-off point epds . however , study reported many factor related woman , infant family affected prevalence probably postpartum depression . outcome meta-analysis revealed prevalence probably postpartum depression high , increased pandemic affected many risk factor . may recommended healthcare professional take protective improving measure mental health woman high risk perinatal period provide early diagnosis , treatment , monitoring care service .

title: State policies and suicidal behavior among sexual and gender minority college students
abstract: purpose lesbian , gay , bisexual , transgender/nonbinary , queer/questioning ( lgbtq+ ) college student heightened risk suicidal ideation attempt compared cisgender heterosexual student , study examined system-level factor reduce risk . investigated association state-level policy suicidal behavior gender identity ( cisgender sexual minority ; csm , transgender/nonbinary ; tnb ) among u.s. lgbtq + young adult attending 135 institution . method state policy tally , movement advancement project , represent sum lgbtq+-related law , index protective ( positive ) discriminatory ( negative ) legislation overall score ( range : -23.5 42.5 ) . linked tally student survey data lgbtq + young adult participant ( 18–24 year ) 2022–2023 healthy mind study ( n = 15,861 ) . used multilevel model calculate odds ratio ( ) 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) association 10-point increase overall , sexual orientation , gender identity tally suicidal behavior . result 10-point increase overall policy tally associated 8 % reduction odds suicidal ideation csm participant ( = 0.92 , 95 % ci = 0.87 , 0.97 ) 7 % reduction tnb participant ( = 0.93 , 95 % ci = 0.87 , 1.00 ) . association observed overall policy tally suicide attempt among csm , tnb student . observed congruent result sexual orientation- gender-specific tally . conclusion protective state policy associated lower odds suicidal ideation among lgbtq + college student . build upon evidence demonstrating importance system-level protection lgbtq + individual .

title: Combined effects of social health and long-term exposure to fine particulate matter on cardiovascular disease in Chinese middle-aged and older adults
abstract: purpose social isolation , loneliness , fine particulate matter ( pm_2.5 ) exposure significant social environmental factor frequently cooccur vulnerable population . joint effect factor risk cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) , however , well supported data . study aimed evaluate independent combined effect social isolation , loneliness , long-term pm_2.5 exposure cvd risk interaction social isolation loneliness pm_2.5 exposure cvd risk . method used cox proportional hazard model estimate independent combined effect loneliness , social isolation , long-term pm_2.5 exposure cvd incidence . also conducted interaction analysis investigate whether effect social factor cvd modified level pm_2.5 exposure . result study included 12,544 participant , mean age 58.7 ± 9.4 year . median follow-up 7 year , 1761 cvd event occurred . individual loneliness presented 29 % increased risk cvd ( hazard ratio [ hr ] = 1.290 , 95 % confidence interval [ ci ] : 1.165–1.428 ) . 10 µg/m^3 increase pm_2.5 exposure associated 6 % increase cvd risk ( hr = 1.060 , 95 % ci : 1.028–1.092 ) . significant additive interaction effect observed loneliness pm_2.5 cvd ( p additive interaction = 0.042 ) . conclusion among chinese middle older adult , loneliness long-term pm_2.5 exposure combined effect cvd risk . public health consequence high pm_2.5 exposure pronounced among individual experience feeling loneliness .

title: Addressing the complex needs of homeless youth with early psychosis and comorbid substance use: a naturalistic longitudinal study of 10 years’ experience with EQIIP SOL’s specialized outreach service
abstract: purpose psychosis substance use disorder ( suds ) highly prevalent often co-occurring among homeless youth . eqiip sol , specialized intensive outreach program within early intervention service , provides 3-year comprehensive care first-episode psychosis ( fep ) homeless youth , targeting psychosis , sud , homelessness . study aim examine clinical functional outcome , along predictor housing stability , among youth enrolled program since inception 2012. method longitudinal study examined 3-year outcome youth admitted eqiip sol 2012 2020. inclusion criterion encompassed youth aged 18–30 year , diagnosed primary psychosis sud experiencing homelessness . assessment conducted baseline 1 , 3 , 6 , 9 , 12 , 15 , 18 , 24 , 36 month thereafter describe housing stability , illness severity , general functioning evolution . alcohol substance use evaluated baseline annually . multivariate mixed-effects model investigated baseline predictor housing stability . result 177 enrolled youth , 81.4 % achieved housing stability least , within median six month . improvement illness severity general functioning observed initial nine month , plateauing thereafter . suds reduced approximately one-third ; alcohol use disorder decreased half . older age ( = 1.18 ( 1.07–1.31 ) ) , history chronic homelessness ( = 2.16 ( 1.13–4.13 ) ) , stimulant addiction ( = 0.51 ( 0.26–0.98 ) ) roofless/emergency sheltered admission ( = 0.41 ( 0.19–0.88 ) ) associated housing stability . conclusion eqiip sol ’ integrated approach yield promising result , warranting replication , robust evaluation efficacy , adaptation setting .

title: Suicide deaths among reproductive-aged women in the US post-Dobbs: a national time-series analysis
abstract: purpose united state supreme court ’ dobbs decision june 2022 may worsened mental health among reproductive-aged woman nationally . examined whether dobbs decision preceded increase suicide among reproductive-aged woman using national , monthly data , january 2018-december 2023. method retrieved national monthly suicide count january 2018 december 2023 woman men 15–49 year age ( overall stratified two age groups- 15–24 year , 25–49 year ) center disease control prevention ’ wide-ranging online data epidemiologic research multiple cause death database . used time series analysis examine whether residual nationally aggregated count monthly suicide among woman 15–49 , 15–24- 25–49-years age ( outcome ) exhibited higher-than-expected value following dobbs decision , controlling autocorrelation concomitant monthly series suicide among men . result observed higher-than-expected residual suicide july september 2022 among 15–49-year-old woman , september , october , december 2022 march 2023 among 15–24-year-old woman . residual outlier observed among 25–49-year-old woman post- dobbs . result time-series analysis indicate average 52.5 additional suicide outlier month among 15–49-year-old woman post- dobbs ( 95 % confidence interval [ ci ] : 14.85 , 90.15 ) . increase appeared pronounced among younger age ( 15–24 year ) woman ( coefficient = 19.6 , 95 % ci : 11.17 , 28.03 ) . result suggest 104 additional suicide among 15–49-year-old woman , 78 excess suicide among 15–24-year-old woman , nationally , post- dobbs . conclusion finding highlight adverse impact dobbs ruling mental health among reproductive-aged woman .

title: Night eating syndrome prevalence and its association with sleep quality, eating patterns, and psychopathology in an Israeli community sample
abstract: introduction night eating syndrome ( ne ) involves hyperphagia nocturnal ingestion , causing significant distress impairment . despite impact , ne poorly understood underdiagnosed clinical community setting . prevalence rate vary , highlighting need research community sample . purpose ne prevalence community sample relationship sleep disturbance , eating pattern , psychopathology . method total 746 participant ( age 21–51 ) , including 377 men ( 50.5 % ) , recruited large israeli online platform . participant completed self-report demographic data questionnaire assessing ne , sleep disturbance , eating pattern , psychopathology . result prevalence ne ( night eating questionnaire/neq : score > 25 , score > 21 ) 8.8 % 18.2 % , respectively . significant difference ne prevalence found gender age group variable . significant difference ne non-nes group term bmi , age , gender . however , significant difference found sleep disturbance ( psqi total ) , depression , anxiety . ne group significantly associated higher level fat carbohydrate consumption evening night . conclusion ne prevalence among study participant relatively higher among previous community sample worldwide , despite participant bmi within normal range . higher prevalence , along significant association lower sleep quality , higher level anxiety depression , increased fat carbohydrate consumption , underscore need greater emphasis diagnosis , treatment , prevention ne community beyond cultural difference .

title: Exploring like-attracts-like friendships in diagnosed and self-diagnosed populations: a description of 2 systematic reviews
abstract: introduction homophilic selection tendency individual affiliate befriend peer initially similar variety behavioral physical characteristic [ 1 ] . paper present 2 systematic review exploring homophilic ( friendship ) selection : amongst individual diagnosed psychiatric condition , amongst individual self-diagnose . review aim identify existing literature subject argue support research area . method first review , ‘ individual diagnosed psychiatric condition exhibit homophilic friendship selection ? ’ , began two-wave database search psycinfo , medline , embase december 7th 2023 august 7th 2024 via ovid . citation search accepted paper conducted independently 3 author produced 17 paper 24,546 screened detailed eligibility criterion . result conlusion publication studying depression observed homophilic selection reliably ( 12,642 participant across 12 paper recruited investigate homophilic selection depression ) . however , condition like anxiety largely exempt investigation , consideration ethnic background age , discussed oversight . method result second review , ‘ individual self-diagnosed psychiatric condition exhibit homophilic friendship selection ? ’ , conducted via method august 8th 2024 produce paper fulfilling single eligibility criterion ‘ friendship behaviour individual self-diagnosed mental illness ’ . conclusion complete absence research friendship behaviour self-diagnosing mental health population . given increasing number individual across psychiatric condition currently self-diagnose , research considerable academic clinical value , discussed .

title: Association of social isolation and loneliness with incident cardiovascular diseases: results from a nationally prospective cohorts in China
abstract: aim social isolation loneliness associated increased risk cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) . research examining effect social isolation loneliness cvd based western country . study examined effect loneliness social isolation cardiovascular disease china . method data derived china health retirement longitudinal study ( charls ) . social isolation , loneliness cvd measured baseline . analytical sample size 6,860 analysis self-reported cvd . cox proportional-hazard regression adjusted confounding factor used association baseline isolation , loneliness , cvd . result incident cvd followed-up 2011 2018 . 7 year follow-up , found loneliness associated increased risk cvd event ( adjusted hr , 1.24 ; 95 % ci , 1.06–1.44 ) . moderately isolated group , loneliness significantly associated elevated risk incident cvd adjusting confounders ( adjusted hr , 1.40 ; 95 % ci , 1.13–1.73 ) . loneliness significantly associated increased risk incident cvd among female participant ( adjusted hr , 1.29 ; 95 % ci , 1.07–1.56 ) . conclusion loneliness significantly increased risk incident cvd , social isolation exhibit similar correlation . finding suggest targeted practical social intervention could improve accuracy efficiency identifying individual high risk .

title: Ethnicity and involuntary hospitalisation: a study of intersectional effects
abstract: purpose study found mental health act used disproportionally among minoritised ethnicity . yet , little research conducted understand intersectionality ethnicity sociodemographic factor relates involuntary admission . study aimed investigate whether association ethnicity involuntary hospitalisation altered variation service-users ’ sociodemographic position . method retrospective cohort study using record south london maudsley identified 18,569 service-users first episode hospitalisation 13-year period . logistic regression used calculate odds ratio involuntary hospitalisation across ethnicity adjusting sociodemographic ( age , gender , area-level deprivation , homelessness , migration ) clinical factor ( psychiatric diagnosis honos score ) . interaction analysis conducted identify intersectional effect ethnicity sociodemographic variable , potentially modifying odds ratio involuntary admission across ethnic group . result increased odds involuntary hospitalisation compared white british service-users observed among 10 14 ethnicity , around , twice odds observed asian chinese , black african , black caribbean . woman found increased odds involuntary admission . significant interaction present ethnicity age , area-level deprivation , homelessness , migration unadjusted model . effect modification significant adjustment confounders . conclusion ethnic inequality observed involuntary hospitalisation among service-users first admission . evidence intersectional effect present adjusting sociodemographic clinical factor . research need identify mechanism causing inequality .

title: Associations of community socioeconomic factors and opioid use disorder across an urban-to-rural spectrum in Pennsylvania: an electronic health record-based case-control study
abstract: purpose elucidate role community socioeconomic condition creating opioid-related risk environment , assessed community-level socioeconomic measure association opioid use disorder ( oud ) across diverse geography . method conducted case-control study using medical record ( 2012–2020 ) pennsylvania health system identify case oud ( n = 14,674 ) control ( n = 58,696 ; frequency-matched age , sex , year , medical record duration ) . residential address used assign community-level measure : community socioeconomic deprivation ( csd ) , high proportional housing cost ( hphc ) , population service occupation ( pso ) , community credit score ( cc ) . logistic regression analyzed association community type ( city census tract [ cct ] , borough , township ) community socioeconomic feature ( stratified community type ) oud , adjusting demographic individual-level socioeconomic status . result cct borough ( versus township ) residence associated higher oud odds . csd , hphc , cc associated oud across community type ; pso associated ccts . highest ( versus lowest ) level csd associated ( odds ratio , 95 % ci ) higher oud odds among individual township ( 1.18 [ 1.03 , 1.36 ] ) , borough ( 1.34 [ 1.09 , 1.63 ] ) , ccts ( 1.46 [ 1.13 , 1.88 ] ) . “ good ” ( versus “ high fair ” ) cc associated lower odds township ( 0.78 [ 0.71 , 0.86 ] ) , borough ( 0.56 [ 0.41 , 0.77 ] ) , ccts ( 0.73 [ 0.44 , 1.22 ] ) . conclusion finding indicate poor community socioeconomic condition related higher oud risk , highlight value research regarding opioid-related risk environment , suggest structural policy intervention , vocational training rent subsidy , important addressing root cause oud .

title: Clinical features and mortality outcomes of people transferred from prison to forensic mental health units: a nationwide 14-year retrospective cohort study
abstract: purpose describe cohort people transferred prison psychiatric hospital care mortality outcome . method retrospective nationwide cohort people ( n = 1320 ) transferred prison psychiatric hospital new zealand 2009 2022. follow commenced first transfer ended 30 june 2023 death earlier . ministry health record used describe cohort service utilization profile . record linked official mortality data , mortality ratio calculated using publicly available life table . result cohort 85 % male 55 % māori , median age 31.2 year . psychotic disorder ( 74 % ) bipolar disorder ( 11 % ) high level coexisting substance use disorder . follow-up duration ranged 2 month 14.5 year ( median 7.5 year ) first transfer , 17 % psychiatric hospital . age sex-standardised mortality ratio cohort compared new zealand population 4.7 ( 95 % ci 3.6–5.9 ) . among death known cause , 60 % natural cause 40 % injury including suicide . conclusion despite extended period psychiatric hospitalization high mortality among people cohort . investment targeted prevention coordinated , continuous healthcare needed people serious mental illness experience incarceration .

title: The burden of mental disorders and substance abuse in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region: findings from the Global Burden of Disease Study
abstract: background mental disorder pose significant morbidity mortality risk globally . despite , research mental health middle east north africa ( mena ) region scarce , hindered social stigma limited healthcare expenditure . study , utilizing global burden disease ( gbd ) database , aim address gap examining prevalence , incidence , demographic pattern mental disorder mena . method ecological study draw gbd data prevalence burden mental disorder substance abuse across mena region 1990 2019. utilizing age-standardized rate prevalence disability-adjusted life year ( dalys ) , examine evolving burden mental disorder , variation among mena country , trend associated risk factor age gender . result 1990 2019 , mena region witnessed varying trend mental disorder . age-standardized prevalence rate 2019 14,938 per 100,000 individual , experiencing 2.1 % decrease overall . however , all-age prevalence surged 86.2 % . disorder like schizophrenia depressive disorder exhibited substantial increase , contrasting 128.1 % rise substance use disorder . temporal analysis revealed fluctuation daly trend , capturing dynamic nature mental health burden time . risk factor , including bullying victimization intimate partner violence , underwent shift , reflecting changing contributor mental health burden . conclusion ( ) despite decrease age-standardized prevalence rate 2019 , substantial all-age prevalence rise demand attention . temporal analysis unraveled nuanced trend , emphasizing complex interplay sociocultural factor . shifting prominence risk factor underscore dynamic nature mental health burden , necessitating region-specific intervention address prevalence pattern contributing factor . future research delve specific sociocultural determinant influencing observed trend , allowing tailored intervention mitigate burden mental health disorder mena region .

title: Factors influencing the length of stay in the psychiatric unit of a Ghanaian teaching hospital: a retrospective study
abstract: purpose psychiatric length stay ( los ) community-based hospital facility sub-saharan africa reflects quality service delivery presence resource challenge . study aimed determine average los identify factor associated prolonged los psychiatric unit ghanaian teaching hospital . method study analysed 1143 hospital discharge record psychiatric inpatient komfo anokye teaching hospital psychiatric unit january 2016 october 2020. los greater median 10 day classified prolonged . performed multivariable logistic regression determine factor associated prolonged los . result mean los 12 day , median los 10 day . bipolar related disorder ( aor = 1.68 95 % ci ( 1.28–2.21 ) ) , substance use disorder ( aor = 1.98 95 % ci ( 1.19–3.30 ) ) , co-occurring mental health substance use disorder ( aor = 2.30 95 % ci ( 1.20–4.56 ) ) , discharged home directly ( aor = 1.91 95 % ci ( 1.03–3.69 ) ) associated longer hospital stay , suicide-related behaviour ( aor = 0.27 95 % ci ( 0.09–0.72 ) ) associated decreased odds prolonged hospital stay . conclusion possible intervention reduce length psychiatric stay general hospital setting include improving functional integration mental health primary care implementing transitional treatment programme like partial hospitalisation intensive outpatient treatment programme . improving access residential substance use treatment another intervention help decrease burden prolonged psychiatric stay .

title: Investigating the impact of parallel media engagement initiatives on suicide reporting in Canada and Israel
abstract: purpose contrast change suicide-related medium reporting quality parallel initiative engage national medium canada israel . method coded medium article canada ’ israel ’ highest circulating newspaper ( major broadsheet tabloid newspaper , respectively ) putatively harmful putatively protective suicide-related content . sample 150 article ( 30/year ) country randomly selected three time point : 2012 ( t1 ; prior medium engagement ) , 2016–2017 ( t2 ; early medium engagement ) , 2018–2019 ( t3 ; late medium engagement ) . chi-square test binary logistic regression investigated overall between-country difference reporting quality time . result following medium engagement , adherence guideline improved time country variable . time , fewer canadian israeli article covered celebrity suicide ( = 4.97 ; 95 % ci 1.68–16.69 ) ; canadian fewer israeli article covered warning sign suicide ( = 0.30 ; 95 % ci 0.12–0.78 ) . comparing article entire timespan ( t1-t3 ) , higher proportion israeli tabloid article included putatively harmful content , mentioning suicide mean ( israel : 65.3 % vs. canada 25.3 % , χ^2 ( 1 ) = 48.4 , p < 0.001 ) , higher proportion canadian broadsheet article included putatively protective content , providing information intervention ( israel : 2.0 % vs. canada 27.3 % , χ^2 ( 1 ) = 38.5 , p < 0.001 ) . conclusion medium engagement appeared confer benefit country publication format . higher proportion canadian article adhered several specific recommendation . finding must interpreted context difference format major canadian israeli newspaper ( broadsheet vs. tabloid ) much higher total volume suicide-related article canada .
