2.64 [ 95 % ci 1.27 , 5.48 ] ; 2.55 [ 95 % ci 1.22,5.35 ] ; 2.78 [ 95 % ci 1.64 , 4.71 ] ) . however , result additive multiplicative interaction indicated synergistic effect heavy alcohol consumption depression all-cause cause-specific mortality reach statistical significance . conclusion finding confirmed heavy alcohol consumption depression associated increased risk all-cause other-cause mortality . although synergistic effect comorbid heavy alcohol consumption depression all-cause cause-specific mortality reach statistical significance , comorbidity heavy alcohol consumption depression associated highest risk all-cause cause-specific mortality . research could provide foundation investigation mechanism underlying comorbidity heavy alcohol consumption depression , well intervention depression among heavy alcohol consumer , significant implication public health clinical practice . graphical abstract

title: Mental health service contact in children with and without physical-mental multimorbidity
abstract: purpose estimate six-month prevalence child mental health service contact quantify association child health status mental health service contact , including number type contact . method data come 6,242 child aged 4–17 year ontario child health study . list chronic condition developed statistic canada measured physical illness . emotional behavioural scale assessed mental illness . child health status categorized healthy , physical illness , mental illness , multimorbid ( ≥ 1 physical ≥ 1 mental illness ) . mental health service contact aggregated general medicine , urgent medicine , specialized mental health , school-based , alternative , contact ( ≥ 1 aforementioned contact ) . regression model quantified association health status type mental health contact , including number type contact . result weighted prevalence estimate showed 261,739 ( 21.4 % ) child mental health-related service contact , school-based service common contact amongst child , regardless health status . child multimorbidity higher odds every mental health contact healthy control ( range : 4.00-6.70 ) . dose-response observed , number contact increased physical illness ( = 1.49 , ci : 1.10–1.99 ) mental illness ( = 3.39 , ci : 2.59–4.44 ) multimorbidity ( = 4.13 , ci : 2.78–6.15 ) . conclusion one-fifth child mental health-related service contact contact highest among child multimorbidity . type mental health contact child multimorbidity diverse , research needed elucidate barrier facilitator mental health use .

title: Trajectories of mental health symptoms, suicide attempts and substance use disorders among women after prison release in Santiago, Chile
abstract: purpose limited research characterized mental health change persists reentry , particularly among woman , minority criminal legal system . aimed describe mental health symptom trajectory group , suicide attempt , substance use dependence , mental healthcare utilization among formerly incarcerated woman santiago , chile , 1-year release . method assessed 200 woman five-wave prospective cohort study using three different mental health indicator : symptom checklist 90-revised ( scl-90-r ) scale release one week , two , six , twelve month release , self-reported suicide attempt , substance use dependence using mini neuropsychiatric interview . used latent class growth analysis identify group following similar symptom trajectory using global severity index scl-90-r. performed multinomial logistic regression identify correlate outcome . result three trajectory group identified : low ( 85.8 % ) , increasing ( 6.8 % ) , high ( 7.4 % ) symptom severity . 19.3 % attempted suicide follow-up . 18.9 % met criterion substance use dependence baseline twelve month . multivariate regression analysis , previous number conviction victimization experience associated outcome . 10 % le received mental health service measurement . conclusion woman stable severity mental health symptom first year release . pre-release cross-sectional screening miss group increasing symptom severity substance use dependence reentry . routine mental health assessment would useful reentry guidance make better use service critical period .

title: Association between changes in family relationship status and suicidal ideation among individuals with physical disabilities
abstract: purpose individual physical disability higher risk suicide due daily activity limitation dependency others . family relationship important mental health well-being . study investigated impact change family relationship status physically disabled individual suicidal ideation . method used data disability life dynamic panel 2018–2022 . total 3,704 individual used analysis . family relationship classified four group : 1 ) good → good , 2 ) poor → good , 3 ) good → poor , 4 ) poor → poor . assessed suicidal ideation attempt based self-reported questionnaire . generalized estimating equation model used analyze impact change family relationship suicidal ideation people physical disability . result individual physical disability whose family relationship declined 1.63 time likely suicidal ideation ( 95 % ci 1.22–2.19 ) compared consistently good family relationship . among subfactors family relationship , family problem-solving ability showed strongest association suicidal ideation deteriorated ( 1.34 , 95 % ci 1.03–1.74 ) . individual consistently poor family relationship 1.78 time likely suicidal ideation alone ( 95 % ci 1.33–2.38 ) 2.29 time likely suicidal ideation attempt ( 95 % ci 0.89–5.93 ) . conclusion finding suggest importance addressing family relationship suicide prevention strategy mental health intervention individual physical disability .

title: Sex differences in schizophrenia spectrum disorders: insights from the DiAPAson study using a data-driven approach
abstract: purpose schizophrenia spectrum disorder ( ssd ) display notable sex difference : male earlier onset severe negative symptom , female exhibit affective symptom , better verbal ability , favourable prognosis . despite extensive research , area time perception positivity remain underexplored , machine learning yet adequately utilised . study aim address gap examining sex difference sample italian patient ssd using data-driven approach . method part diapason project , 619 italian patient ssd ( 198 female ; 421 male ) assessed using standardised clinical tool . data socio-demographics , clinical characteristic , symptom severity , functioning , positivity , quality life ( qol ) , time perspective collected . descriptive regression analysis conducted . principal component analysis ( pca ) gaussian mixture model ( gmm ) used define data-driven cluster . leave-one-group-out validation performed . result male likely single ( p < 0.001 ) le educated ( p = 0.006 ) , female smoked tobacco ( p = 0.011 ) . male frequently prescribed antipsychotic ( p = 0.022 ) exhibited severe psychiatric ( p = 0.004 ) negative symptom ( p = 0.013 ) . also le negative perception past event ( p = 0.047 ) better view psychological condition ( p = 0.004 ) . female showed better interpersonal functioning ( p = 0.008 ) . pca gmm revealed two main cluster significant sex difference ( p = 0.027 ) . conclusion study identifies sex difference ssd , suggesting tailored treatment enhancing interpersonal skill female maintaining positive self-assessment male . using machine learning , highlight distinct ssd phenotype , emphasising need sex-specific intervention improve outcome qol . finding stress importance multifaceted , interdisciplinary approach address sex-based disparity ssd . trial registration isrctn registry id isrctn21141466 .

title: Epidemiology of adult separation anxiety disorder in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia: results from the Saudi National Mental Health Survey
abstract: purpose adult separation anxiety disorder ( asad ) thought prevalent debilitating , yet many aspect epidemiology remain unclear . aimed investigate prevalence , course , correlate , comorbidity , impairment , treatment asad saudi arabia . method study analyzed subset 1793 participant saudi national mental health survey ; nationally representative household sample saudi citizen . survey used cidi 3.0 produce prevalence estimate asad common dsm-iv mental disorder . cross tabulation , survival analysis logistic regression used analyse data . result lifetime 12-month prevalence asad 7.6 % 3.8 % , respectively . half ( 51.7 % ) participant lifetime asad onset adulthood , 50.5 % lifetime asad also 12-month asad . lifetime asad significantly associated female ( = 2.1 ) , married ( = 2.2–3.2 ) , low education ( = 0.4 ) , maladaptive family functioning ( = 3.6–6.7 ) . primary lifetime asad strong predictor subsequent mental disorder ( = 1.1–6.5 ) . , mood , impulse , substance use disorder significantly associated subsequent first onset asad ( = 2.15-3.0 ) . asad severely impairing presence ( 59.0 % ) absence ( 56.2 % ) 12-month comorbidity . among lifetime asad , 26.1 % reported treatment mental health condition . conclusion asad prevalent , persistent course associated impairment , well substantial comorbidity limited treatment saudi arabia . increasing awareness , early diagnosis , treatment asad may help reduce burden .

title: Combat exposure, social support, and posttraumatic stress: a longitudinal test of the stress-buffering hypothesis among veterans of the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq
abstract: purpose social support widely viewed protective factor posttraumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) , study directly tested whether social support buffer long-term effect pre-existing ptsd symptom baseline combat exposure among veteran ( i.e . , stress-buffering hypothesis ) . method address gap , current study tested perceived social support moderator effect baseline ptsd symptom combat exposure ptsd symptom 10-year follow sample post-911 veteran ( n = 783 ) . result higher level combat exposure baseline ptsd symptom predicted elevated ptsd symptom 10-year follow-up . perceived social support moderated effect , impact baseline symptom combat exposure attenuated veteran high level perceived support . however , buffering effect le evident higher level combat exposure significant high level baseline ptsd symptom . conclusion finding broadly consistent stress-buffering hypothesis , result present study suggest benefit perceived social support may le evident higher level combat exposure . result also offer preliminary evidence perceived social support le protective veteran severe pre-existing symptom .

title: Exploring the association between adolescent psychotic-like experiences and components of social performance using a multi-level virtual reality paradigm
abstract: background despite evidence linking psychotic-like experience ( ples ) social functioning deficit youth risk transitioning psychosis , association remains poorly understood . address , explored association component social performance ples adolescent aged 13–18 using novel virtual reality ( vr ) paradigm real-time assessment . method adolescent ( n = 146 ) aged 13–18 recruited part larger cohort study conducted research group ( yvori_pro ) invited participate via following criterion : reporting highly indicative positive ples ( hip , n = 88 ) reporting le indicative ples ( no-hip , n = 58 ) . self-report , behavioural physiological component social performance collected using portable vr headset medical wristband . participant entered virtual recreational area three level social ambiguity encouraged interact avatar . manova performed check overall group difference repeated measure anova conducted examine effect group level ambiguity , well interaction , daily social performance . result virtual social interaction , adolescent hip reported higher level anxiety , fear negative evaluation ( fne ) avoidance no-hip group . significant difference group found self-confidence . increasing social ambiguity vr , anxiety , fne avoidance increased group , self-confidence decreased . significant group difference found behavioural physiological component social performance . interpersonal distance pulse rate increased significantly increasing level ambiguity , pulse rate variability skin conductance . conclusion result suggest adolescent hip may present specific difficulty related social performance , may carry additional psychosis risk . new vr social scenario appears acceptable , safe effective tool measure social performance adolescent experiencing ples .

title: The effect of peer victimisation on cognitive development in childhood: evidence for mediation via inflammation
abstract: purpose peer victimisation , often serious childhood stressor , associated poor cognitive outcome . current study sought uncover whether peer victimisation associated poor cognitive functioning childhood via inflammation . method data 4583 participant avon longitudinal study parent child ( alspac ) analysed . path analysis conducted determine whether inflammation , measured using il-6 crp level ( age 9 ) , mediates effect peer victimisation ( age 8 ) , even controlling stressor , multiple cognitive outcome , including working memory ( age 10 ) , reading ( accuracy , speed , comprehension ) ( age 9 ) , spelling ( age 9 ) , response inhibition ( age 10 ) , attentional control ( age 11 ) , selective attention ( age 11 ) . result il-6 crp partially mediated effect peer victimisation working memory , reading accuracy , selective attention . il-6 partially mediated effect peer victimisation reading comprehension , crp partially mediated effect peer victimisation reading speed . effect small . inflammation mediate effect peer victimisation spelling , response inhibition attentional control . conclusion peer victimisation may impact aspect child ’ cognitive functioning via inflammation . cognitive outcome specificity observed warrant research .

title: Sexual orientation differences in mental health service use and unmet mental health care needs: a cross-sectional population-based study of young adults
abstract: purpose study aim examine sexual orientation difference mental health service use unmet mental health care need , explore associated sociodemographic factor populational-based sample swedish young adult ( aged 18–34 ) . method data pathway longitudinally understanding stress ( plus ) study used ( 2019 , n = 2,126 , participation rate 37.8 % ) . performed logistic regression model mental health service use unmet mental health service need , followed subgroup analysis among perceived need mental health service . also examined association sociodemographic factor ( gender , age , educational level , income , employment status , household composition , urbanicity country birth ) outcome varied sexual orientation . result around one-third ( 35.0 % ) sexual minority individual used mental health service previous year , versus 20.2 % heterosexual ( = 1.52 , 95 % ci = 1.17–1.96 , p = 0.002 ) . unmet need likely among sexual minority individual ( 17.6 % ) heterosexual ( 11.8 % , = 1.47 , 95 % ci = 1.09-2.00 , p = 0.013 ) , significant sexual orientation difference among participant perceiving need mental health service . among perceived need mental health service , estimated 56 % sexual minority male unmet need ( vs. 37 % heterosexual ) ; difference existed among woman . gender , significant interaction sociodemographic factor sexual orientation . conclusion sexual minority individual ’ higher mental health service use highlight need high-quality , culturally sensitive service . future research identify reason greater proportion unmet mental health service need among sexual minority men .

title: Clinical treatment interventions in personal recovery stories of patients with severe mental illness: a qualitative study
abstract: purpose quantitative research , small medium association found clinical personal recovery patient severe mental illness ( smi ) . finding may result varying relationship clinical personal recovery depending individual patient . aim current study explore subjective experience clinical treatment intervention personal recovery story patient severe mental illness . method semi-structured interview conducted 26 patient smi receiving treatment flexible assertive community treatment team amsterdam , netherlands . thematic analysis used . result found clinical treatment intervention positive negative impact personal recovery : ( 1 ) receiving diagnosis lead relief , also stigma , ( 2 ) medication positive effect , side-effects impair personal recovery , ( 3 ) hospitalization ( 4 ) coercive treatment helpful , also impact process recovery negatively , ( 5 ) psychological treatment experienced beneficial . conclusion mental healthcare practitioner ’ awareness patient ’ diverging experience regarding impact clinical treatment intervention personal recovery important carry recovery-supportive practice . communicating diagnosis hopeful narrative , developing personalized medication strategy post-hospital reflection use restraint good basis .

title: The relationship between gender identity, economic stressors, social support, concurrent substance use and suicidal ideation
abstract: purpose examine comprehensive list demographic , substance use , economic , social factor associated suicidal ideation ( si ) among middle-aged adult . method cross-sectional data obtained national sample middle-aged adult february november 2022. study ’ final sample include 1,337 respondent represented adult population person aged 40–60 year united state . bivariate multivariate statistic employed identify significant factor associated past year si , including examination factor associated single si multiple instance si past year . result sample , 140 ( 10.4 % ) reported si past year . among , half ( 60.0 % , n = 84 ) reported si multiple time past year . multivariable logistic regression indicated reported lower standard living compared parents/caregivers ( adjusted odds ratio [ aor ] 2.62 ) , gender minority ( aor 7.06 ) , engaged concurrent substance use ( aor 3.29 ) , unemployed ( aor 1.80 ) significantly higher odds past year si , whereas higher social support protective si ( aor 0.69 ) . multinomial regression found concurrent substance use , unemployment , lower standard living parents/caregivers predicted repeated past year si whereas higher social support protective multiple si experience ( aor 0.65 ) . conclusion middle-aged adult reporting concurrent substance use , lower social support , unemployment gender minority higher odds past year si . finding underscore need develop public health clinical intervention tailored highest-risk middle-aged adult order prevent suicide .

title: Prevalence estimates of depression and anxiety symptoms among adolescents in Bermuda, according to age, gender and race
abstract: purpose common mental disorder ( cmds ) among adolescent , anxiety depression , associated significant impairment exacerbated covid-19 pandemic . caribbean , including bermuda , lack sufficient cmd prevalence data inform policy service provision adolescent mental health . study sought estimate prevalence depression anxiety symptom among adolescent bermuda . method cross-sectional study surveyed middle high school student aged 10–18 year bermuda . 15 school participated data collection . online survey conducted november 2022 - june 2023 gathered demographic data assessed depression symptom using phq-8 , anxiety symptom using gad-7 , impairment across daily activity , school/work relationship . result total 2,526 adolescent bermuda self-reported depression anxiety symptom , estimate prevalence moderate severe depression symptom 31.3 % . prevalence significantly higher among older adolescent , female identified black minority . among 25.2 % reported moderate severe anxiety symptom , prevalence significantly higher among older adolescent , female identify minority . furthermore , 65.6 % adolescent self-reporting moderate severe depression symptom reported comorbid moderate severe anxiety symptom . rate impairment depression anxiety 22.6 % 19.1 % , respectively . conclusion prevalence depressive anxiety symptom among bermuda ’ adolescent high , surpassing post-pandemic global average . finding improve understanding cmds caribbean provide direction improved policy service provision bermuda .

title: Associations of common mental disorder severity with treatment contact and treatment intensity, and its changes over twelve years
abstract: purpose guide formal healthcare resource allocation common mental disorder ( cmds ) , study update expands earlier finding association cmd severity treatment contact intensity . method baseline data ( 2019–2022 ) nemesis-3 , prospective study representative cohort dutch adult ( 18–75 year ) , used . severity 12-month cmds assessed cidi 3.0. using multivariate analysis , association 12-month treatment contact intensity emotional/substance-use problem examined , general medical care ( gmc ) mental health care ( mhc ) . change time identified making comparison baseline data ( 2007–2009 ) nemesis-2 . result person severe cmds likely made contact gmc mhc compared person without cmds . 2007–2009 2019–2022 greater increase contact rate gmc moderate case compared person without cmds , increasing contact rate mhc vary cmd severity . among user gmc mhc , receiving high-intensity treatment likely among severe case compared person without cmds . 2007–2009 2019–2022 greater increase rate high-intensity treatment severe case using gmc , result tentatively indicate rate declined among severe case using mhc . conclusion evidence found treatment cmds gmc strengthened past twelve year . indication found allocation mhc resource severe case improved .

title: Exploring ageism and ageing anxiety: a cross-sectional study in Egypt
abstract: background ageism ageing anxiety obstacle health equity community . study aim ageism ageing anxiety egypt elaborate factor associated ageism among egyptian . method conducted cross-sectional online survey 359 adult egyptian using predesigned questionnaire socio-demographic factor , fraboni scale ageism ( fsa ) , ageing anxiety scale ( aa ) , one question contact older adult , another question religiosity . result mean age respondent 27.91 year ( sd = 8.99 ) , half aged 18 25 year , majority woman ( 68 % ) . mean total score ageism 72.79 ( 6.3 ) 116 , mean total score anxiety ageing 54.33 ( 8.83 ) 100. male gender ( b = 0.117 , p = 0.024 ) , infrequent contact older adult ( b = 0.163 , p = 0.002 ) , ageing anxiety ( b = 0.238 , p = 0.000 ) , insufficient income ( b = 0.202 , p = 0.007 ) associated increased ageism score . conclusion observed association ageism factor male gender , infrequent contact older adult , insufficient income , ageing anxiety highlight potential need focused educational initiative . implementing comprehensive educational program inform individual ageing process also promote positive intergenerational interaction could serve promising strategy combat ageism .

title: Cognitive trajectories in older adults and associated mortality and predictors
abstract: purpose test hypothesis declining cognitive aging trajectory would increase mortality risk predictor mortality would differ trajectory group . method sub-study zarademp project studying dementia depression older adult aged 55 year , conducted zaragoza , spain , including 2403 cognitively healthy individual completed least three four wave 12-year follow-up . three cognitive trajectory previously identified based mini-mental state examination ( mmse ) . mortality information obtained city ’ official population registry registered 6 year end fourth wave study . cox proportional hazard regression analysis analyzing risk death performed globally cognitive trajectory . result follow-up , 42.4 % participant died . individual class 2-moderate-stable class 3-low-and-declining 24 % 96 % , respectively , higher risk mortality class 1-high-to-moderate . younger woman showed significant lower risk death class . single , diabetes , dependency basic activity daily living , ex-drinkers , smoker , ex-smokers increased risk class 2. hypertension showed higher risk death high-to-moderate group . low-and-declining trajectory , anxiety nearly tripled risk death . conclusion trajectory cognitive decline associated higher mortality , risk death showing gradient . predictor mortality differ cognitive trajectory ; difference observed even among cognitively healthier group .

title: A machine learning language model approach to evaluating mental health awareness content across Spanish- and English-language social media posts on Twitter
abstract: purpose mental health information appears social medium varying level quality may may productive information user , particularly relation healthcare decision-making community living among diverse population coping mental health problem . better understand mental health landscape social medium , study validated language model approach evaluating availability sentiment mental health awareness content across spanish- english-language social medium post twitter ( currently x ) inform future mental health communication guideline . method comprehensive list mental health awareness hashtags spanish english developed bilingual investigator download tweet containing hashtags language twitter academic api 09/19/22 − 10/10/22 . data extraction cleaning duplicate tweet resulted final sample 28,268 spanish 205,774 english tweet sentiment structural topic analysis across two language . result fifteen unique topic emerged spanish english tweet including overlapping theme awareness , self-care , lived experience , service provider . topic spanish tweet often significantly associated negative emotion compared english tweet . yet english tweet also included misappropriation mental health label make political statement market product . conclusion mental health awareness content twitter appears consistently available aligned clinical value , disadvantaging spanish-language social medium user , possibly leading divergent priority concerning population mental health . nevertheless , natural language processing technique offer viable method understand unequal mental health awareness content across various language cultural social medium .

title: Beyond shelter: a scoping review of evidence on housing in resettlement countries and refugee mental health and wellbeing
abstract: purpose number displaced people globally rapidly increased past decade . housing important social determinant health key contributor poor health outcome refugee asylum seeker population . important examine evidence housing impact mental health refugee asylum seeker . review seek analyse research describing housing condition policy associated refugee mental health wellbeing high-income resettlement country ( united state , canada , australia ) . method scoping review identified forty-four relevant study . study examined various aspect housing and/or accommodation association mental health wellbeing resettled refugee population . result found evidence relationship four domain housing—policy , suitability , environment time—and mental health . furthermore , found evidence refugee settling high income country experienced significant housing issue . overall , problem housing quality , location , accessibility ( i.e . , nature system govern access housing ) suitability associated poorer mental health outcome . conclusion high-income country , lack choice agency regarding housing contributed poor mental health outcome among refugee asylum seeker . policy practice prioritise quality , suitability , accessibility refugee housing , look way increase choice agency resettlement .

title: Global burden of diseases attributable to childhood sexual abuse and bullying: findings from 1990 to 2019 and predictions to 2035
abstract: purpose childhood sexual abuse ( csa ) bullying serious public health concern influence child , adolescent , adult health . study aim provide updated estimate age- sex- specific death disability-adjusted life year ( dalys ) associated csa bullying 1990 2019 global , regional , national level , forecast global burden disease attributed 2020 2035. method used data number death , dalys , age-standardized rate ( per 100,000 population ) , percentage change , population attributable fraction ( paf ) global burden disease study 2019 ( gbd 2019 ) disease burden attributable csa bullying . applied autoregressive integrated moving average ( arima ) model predict disease burden period 2020 2035. result 2019 , csa bullying accounted 0.02 % 0.28 % global all-cause death dalys , respectively . highest death rate observed men aged 45–49 , woman aged 50–54 . highest dalys rate observed men aged 20–24 woman aged 15–19 . highest age-standardized death dalys rate observed eastern europe region ( 1.222 [ 95 % ui 0.161 , 3.013 ] ) high-income north america region ( 176.613 [ 95 % ui 79.02 , 312.064 ] ) per 100,000 people respectively . el salvador ( 1.523 [ 95 % ui 0.209 , 3.589 ] ) greenland ( 298.014 [ 95 % ui 138.745 , 518.086 ] ) per 100,000 people highest age-standardized- death dalys rate , respectively . highest age-standardized rate csa bullying related death dalys observed high-socio-demographic index ( sdi ) quintile . age-standardized death rate attributable csa bullying projected decrease sex 2019 2035 , whereas age-standardized dalys rate projected decrease male increase female 2019 2035. conclusion csa bullying contributed global disease burden . action needed develop effective policy . study provides policymakers up-to-date comprehensive information .

title: Braving the dark: mental health challenges and academic performance of Ukrainian university students during the war
abstract: purpose paper aim investigate association mental health problem academic performance university student using data cross-sectional survey ukrainian university student war . prevalence mental health problem among student subsequent division different severity group investigated . method study combine cross-sectional survey method collect data regression analysis technique identify mental health problem negatively associated student ’ academic performance war . survey questionnaire includes demographic section , mental health screening tool , well work productivity activity impairment : special health problem ( wpai : shp ) section , adapted purpose study . data sample includes response 1398 university student different region ukraine . result according survey data 85.8 % respondent depression symptom , 66.1 % – anxiety symptom , 56.9 % –sleep problem , 48.1 % – ptsd symptom . result regression modeling confirms devastating effect mental health problem academic performance university student war , particular , severe depression symptom , anxiety symptom sleep problem associated 17.4 % , 12.2 % 11.0 % decrease academic performance university student , respectively . conclusion prevalence mental health problem related academic performance impairment among student wartime become challenge successful recovery ukrainian society therefore require quick response institutional public policy level .

title: Long term outcomes after COVID-19 in patients with schizophrenia: a historical cohort study in a health maintenance organization
abstract: background severe mental illness may affect health behavior outcome pandemic . study assessed whether people living schizophrenia spectrum disorder ( ssd ) experienced adverse covid-19 outcome . method population-based historical cohort study comprising member health maintenance organization , included 1273 patient ssd 12,730 age- sex-matched control tested sars-cov-2 march 2020 may 2022. assessed association schizophrenia hospitalization , hospital length-of-stay , 30-day , one-year mortality , constructing multiple linear regression logistic regression model adjusting sociodemographic factor , bmi , smoking , number comorbidities , vaccination . also assessed whether vaccination modified association schizophrenia mortality . result among patient ssd , 477 ( 37.5 % ) positive test , compared 6203 ( 48.7 % ) comparison group . patient ssd increased risk hospitalization ( adjusted odds ratio ( or_adj ) 3.44 , 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) : 2.88–4.11 , p < 0.001 ) ; longer length-of-stay ( β = 1.20 , p < 0.001 ) ; increased 30-day ( or_adj 9.07 , 95 % ci 3.11–26.44 ) ; one-year mortality ( or_adj 6.27 , 95 % ci : 2.73–14.39 ) . adjustment vaccination altered 30-day mortality ( or_adj 4.54 , 95 % ci : 1.54–13.38 ) . additionally , association schizophrenia 30-day mortality attenuated stratum vaccinated ( 4.79 , 95 % ci : 0.82–28.13 , p = 0.082 ) , vs. unvaccinated individual ( 7.53 , 95 % ci 2.19–25.92 , p = 0.001 ) , respectively . conclusion cohort , patient ssd experienced significantly higher rate hospitalization , length stay , mortality following positive sars-cov-2 test , even adjusting important prognostic factor . covid-19 vaccination modified risk .

title: Met and unmet needs of service users with substance use disorders: a latent class analysis
abstract: purpose people substance use disorder ( sud ) multiple associated health social condition may lead unmet need , even among receiving professional support . furthermore , fragmented nature care provision may also contribute unmet need . therefore , assessed need service user sud identified need profile determinant . aimed identify possible gap care likely hamper recovery pathway examine whether care supply tailored user ’ need . method convenience sample 562 service user sud drawn diverse mental health service belgium , including specialised service sud , assessed using camberwell assessment needs– short appraisal schedule ( patient version ) . additional indicator , including social integration , substance use behaviour , service utilisation , well-being , also collected . latent class analysis performed identify need profile . result three class need profile identified . largest class comprised 40 % sample included individual need . second class encompassed 35 % sample represented whose need mainly met professional . third class , accounting 25 % sample , included individual many unmet need . across class , company , intimate relationship , sexual expression reported unmet need . poor social integration subjective well-being associated need , either met unmet . female ( = 2.76 , p = 0.025 ) , using social service ( = 2.54 , p = 0.022 ) , homecare outreach service ( = 3.683 , p = 0.003 ) likely report met need . contrast , using multiple substance associated unmet need ( = 3.87 , p = 0.008 ) . significant association need profile use specialised service sud . conclusion need people sud go beyond substance use encompass social relationship . although major difference need profile observed based service utilisation , social integration interpersonal relationship deserve greater attention perspective personal recovery people sud .

title: Effect of residential versus ambulatory treatment for substance use disorders on readmission risk in a register-based national retrospective cohort
abstract: purpose article , studied whether pathway substance use disorder ( sud ) treatment differ among people admitted residential versus ambulatory setting . method analyzed retrospective cohort 84,755 adult ( age ≥ 18 ) chilean sud treatment 2010–2019 , creating comparable sample 11,226 pair ambulatory residential treatment cardinality matching . used nine-state multistate model , stratifying readmission baseline treatment outcome ( i.e . , completion vs. noncompletion ) admission third readmission . estimated transition probability length stay state three-month , one-year , three-year , five-year follow-up . sensitivity analysis tested different model specification estimated e-values . result patient residential setting ( vs. ambulatory ) greater treatment completion probability ( difference three month ; 3.4 % [ 95 % ci : 2.9 % , 3.9 % ] ) , longer treatment retention ( e.g . , 1.6 day longer three month , 95 % ci : 0.8 , 2.3 ) . patient residential vs. ambulatory setting higher first readmission probability regardless baseline treatment outcome ( e.g . , three-month difference : 5.7 % completed baseline [ 95 % ci : 4.4 % , 7.0 % ] 8.0 % complete baseline [ 95 % ci : 6.7 , 9.3 % ] ) . third readmission probability higher among patient residential setting incomplete baseline treatment ( least 3.7 % ; 95 % ci : 0.2 % , 7.3 % 1-year ) . conclusion patient residential setting baseline likely experience second treatment third readmission among patient incomplete treatment . finding underscore importance completing initial sud treatment reduce readmission . residential treatment might require additional strategy prevent readmission .

title: Joinpoint analyses of rates on hospital-recorded deliberate self-harm: an update on Danish national trends
abstract: introduction deliberate self-harm ( dsh ) public health concern high rate among adolescent female warrant continuous monitoring . aim study determine trend dsh rate gender age denmark 2000–2021 using joinpoint regression analysis . method cohort design applied national register data individual aged 10 + year living denmark 2000–2021 . dsh episode identified somatic psychiatric hospital data . sex- age-specific incidence rate ( ir ) calculated calendar year . using joinpoint regression analysis , segment change annual percent change ( apc ) identified . result highest dsh rate observed male female aged 19–24 year irs 146.8 ( 95 % ci 142.9–150.7 ) 378.6 ( 95 % ci 372.1–385.0 ) per 100,000 person-years , respectively . major change dsh rate found youngest age group . step decrease found male aged 19–24 year ( -18.4 ; 95 % ci -31.9- -2.3 ; p = < 0.030 ) 2012 2015. significant decline observed 2012–2016 female aged 19–24 year ( -18.9 ; 95 % ci -26.8 – -10.2 ; p = 0.001 ) . poisoning frequently used method . conclusion seemingly , financial recession 2008 affect danish dsh rate . significant decline observed female year mean restrictive measure installed ; thus , supporting potential effect . fluctuation dsh rate among adolescent young adult recent year underscore importance continued monitoring .

title: Post-COVID social engagement and depression among Chinese older adults: exploring rural/urban and gender differences
abstract: purpose study investigates impact post-covid social engagement depression level among chinese older adult , focus rural/urban gender difference . method using year 2018 year 2020 data china health retirement longitudinal study ( charls ) , study analyzed pre- post-covid depression level social engagement indicator , including going-out , activity networking among chinese older adult ( n = 8,793 ) . result result showed significant increase depression level across demographic group post-covid , rural female exhibiting highest level depression . reduced social engagement associated increased depression , particularly among rural male female . subgroup analysis highlighted nuanced pattern : rural male suffered decreased intense activity online contact , urban male experienced heightened depression reduced visiting light activity . rural female reported increased depression decreased moderate activity dancing outdoors decreased level reduced online contact . conversely , urban female experience decreased depression reduced social engagement , suggesting areevaluation priority amidst pandemic challenge . conclusion study underscored importance considering individual , cultural , contextual factor understanding mental health outcome among chinese older adult . finding inform targeted intervention aimed promoting psychological well-being resilience among chinese older adult post-covid era , including community-based program mental health screening , foster social connection emotional support .

title: Utilizing the CFIR framework for mapping the facilitators and barriers of implementing teachers led school mental health programs – a scoping review
abstract: background ample evidence generated regarding effectiveness school-based mental health intervention part continuum care child capacity building teacher deal emotional behavioral challenge student . increasing trend utilization teacher natural support system child huge financial impact public health intervention highlight need review available evidence regarding multilevel factor facilitate pose challenge provision school mental health program ( smhp ) using teacher provider . current review aim map extracted evidence consolidated framework implementation research ( cfir ) domain support future implementation research school-based mental health service . method scoping review included experimental , qualitative study , systematic review involving teacher-led mental health program conducted school setting improve socio-emotional well-being child adolescent irrespective time geographical limitation . title: Clinical course and demographic insights into suicide by self-poisoning: patterns of substance use and socio-economic factors
abstract: purpose analyze whether sociodemographic characteristic influence substance choice preclinical clinical course suicidal poisoning . method retrospective single-center study patient hospitalized due suicidal poisoning received least one psychiatric exploration inpatient stay . patient ’ sociodemographic , anamnestic , preclinical , clinical parameter analyzed respect sex age . result 1090 patient included , 727 ( 67 % ) female , median age 39 year ( min–max : 13–91 ) 603 ( 55 % ) aged 18–44 year . 595 patient ( 54.8 % ) ingested single substance self-poisoning , 609 ( 59.5 % ) used long-term medication . comparing male , female preferred antidepressant ( n = 223 , 30.7 % , v n = 85 , 23.4 % ; p = 0.013 ) benzodiazepine ( n = 202 , 27.8 % , v n = 65 , 17.9 % ; p < 0.001 ) ; male often used cardiovascular drug ( n = 33 , 9.1 % , v n = 34 , 4.7 % ; p = 0.005 ) carbon monoxide ( n = 18 , 5.0 % , v n = 2 , 0.3 % ; p < 0.001 ) . use z-drugs ( n = 1 , 1.7 % , n = 37 , 33.3 % ; p < 0.001 ) benzodiazepine ( n = 4 , 6.9 % , n = 33 , 29.7 % ; p = 0.003 ) increased age ( < 18 > 64 year ) , use non-opioid analgesic ( n = 23 , 39.7 % , n = 20 , 18.0 % ; p < 0.001 ) decreased . average dose substance patient > 64 year 12.9 ± 18.4 time higher recommended maximum daily dose ( compared 8.7 ± 15.2 higher aged < 18 year ; p < 0.001 ) . male often required intensive care ( n = 150 , 41.3 % , v n = 205 female , 28.2 % ; p < 0.001 ) . conclusion result underline complexity ( para- ) suicidal poisoning identify potential measure prevention , restricting access better oversight use certain substance .

title: Associations between multiple sleep dimensions and suicide and non-suicidal self-injury: a cross-sectional study of 3828 Chinese young people
abstract: purpose suicide non-suicidal self-injury ( nssi ) preventable concern young people . suicidal ideation ( si ) , suicidal plan ( sp ) suicidal attempt ( sa ) closely related death . sleep problem known risk factor suicide nssi . study aimed explore relationship sleep , suicidality nssi . method participant 3,828 middle school college student aged 11–23 year urban rural area henan province . sleep , suicidal phenomenon nssi assessed applying self-reported questionnaire . chi-squared test utilized demonstrate demographic data sleep variable . correlation sleep , suicidality nssi explored using binary logistic regression , adjusting socio-demographic characteristic multivariate model . result sleep variable except mid-sleep time related suicidal phenomenon ( p < 0.05 ) . greater social jet lag ( sjl ) [ ≥ 2 h ( h ) ] associated increased risk si [ odds ratio ( ) = 1.72 , 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) :1.40–2.11 ] , sp ( = 2.10 , 95 % ci :1.59–2.79 ) sa ( = 1.50 , 95 % ci :1.00-2.26 ) . non-only child participant sjl ( ≥ 2 h ) significantly increased odds si ( = 1.75 , 95 % ci : 1.41–2.18 ) sp ( = 2.25 , 95 % ci : 1.66–3.05 ) . eveningness chronotype strongest correlation si ( = 3.87 , 95 % ci :2.78–5.38 ) , sp ( = 4.72 , 95 % ci :2.97–7.50 ) , sa ( = 6.69 , 95 % ci :3.08–14.52 ) nssi ( = 1.39 , 95 % ci :1.02–1.90 ) . conclusion overlong short sleep duration , sjl , eveningness chronotype sleep abnormality ( e.g . , daytime dysfunction , low sleep efficiency ) associated higher prevalence si , sp sa . additionally , eveningness significantly correlated nssi among young people . finding suggested importance assessing intervening sleep habit prevent suicide nssi young people .

title: Age, period, and cohort trends of substance poisoning, alcohol-related disease, and suicide deaths in Australia, 1980–2019
abstract: purpose death due substance poisoning , alcohol-related disease , suicide pose critical public health issue , categorized “ death despair ” u . whether death represent distinct phenomenon requires exploration , particularly country . method retrospective observational study examines age-period-cohort trend ( combined cause-specific ) substance poisoning , alcohol-related disease , suicide death among australian aged ≥15-years occurred 1980 2019 compare trend male female . result combined mortality rate initially ( 1980–1999 ) relatively stable , reflecting reduction alcohol-related disease death offset increase substance poisoning death . decline ( 2000–2006 ) subsequent increase ( 2007–2019 ) combined rate primarily attributable corresponding change substance poisoning suicide death among male . distinct age-period-cohort trend observed cause death sub-types , net drift : increasing male ( net drift [ 95 % ci ] : 3.33 [ 2.84 , 3.83 ] ) female ( 2.58 [ 2.18 , 2.98 ] ) substance poisoning death ; decreasing among male alcohol-related disease ( − 1.46 [ − 1.75 , − 1.16 ] ) suicide death ( − 0.52 [ − 0.69 , − 0.36 ] ) ; remaining relatively stable female alcohol-related disease ( − 0.28 [ − 0.66 , 0.09 ] ) suicide death ( − 0.25 [ − 0.52 , 0.01 ] ) . conclusion although combined age-specific trend relatively stable study period , different distinct pattern observed within cause-specific death , challenging notion cause death represent distinct epidemiological phenomenon . data indicate critical need review appropriateness guidance clinical practice , prevention strategy , policy initiative aimed preventing future death .

title: Prevalence of anxiety, depression, and post-traumatic stress disorder among paramedic students: a systematic review and meta-analysis
abstract: purpose elevated mental health concern paramedic student , estimate vary study country , review established overall prevalence . systematic review addressed estimating global prevalence common mental health disorder , namely anxiety , depression , post-traumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) , paramedic student internationally . method systematic search six database , including medline , embase , psycinfo , cinahl , scopus , medrxiv , conducted identify study relating mental health among paramedicine student . search encompassed study inception february 2023. considered inclusion review , study report prevalence data least one symptom anxiety , depression , ptsd paramedicine student , using quantitative validated scale . quality study assessed using joanna briggs institute ( jbi ) checklist , specific methodological tool assessing prevalence study . subgroup analysis conducted due insufficient data . result 1638 article identified search , 193 full text screened , resulting 13 paper systematic review meta-analysis . total number participant 1064 10 country . pooled prevalence moderate ptsd 17.9 % ( 95 % ci 14.8–21.6 % ) , anxiety 56.4 % ( 95 % ci 35,9–75 % ) , depression 34.7 % ( 95 % ci 23.4–48.1 % ) . conclusion systematic review meta-analysis found paramedicine student globally exhibit high prevalence moderate ptsd , anxiety , depression . prevalence mental health condition surpasses among paramedic provider general population , indicated previous review . research therefore warranted determine appropriate support intervention group .

title: The contribution of childhood adversities to the persistence of severe role impairment among college students: a follow-up study
abstract: purpose association childhood adversity ( ca ) negative mental health outcome robustly supported throughout epidemiological literature , little known contribution persistence role impairment . present study aim investigate association three facet ca persistence severe role impairment among college student using follow-up design . method data drawn french portion world mental health international college student initiative . student completed baseline 1-year follow-up survey included ( n = 1,188 ) . exposure 12 type ca age 18 assessed baseline , 12-month role impairment 12-month mental disorder assessed baseline follow-up . logistic regression estimated association jointly using type , number type , cumulative frequency exposure ca predictor . result baseline , 27.6 % student reported severe role impairment . among , 47.5 % reported persistence impairment one year . model adjusted 12-month mental disorder , frequency ca associated persistence impairment , namely college-related work impairment ( = 1.17 , 95 % ci [ 1.01 , 1.35 ] ) . conclusion role impairment prevalent among college student , study needed better understand persistence . beyond primary prevention early stressor , screening treating mental health problem college may help reduce impact ca persistence role impairment .

title: Depression and anxiety in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic: A 6-waves longitudinal study in the Argentine population
abstract: purpose pandemic caused stress due isolation , loss loved one , work learning change , financial instability , fear infection , uncertainty . negatively impacted mental health , particularly increasing anxiety , depression symptom . study analyzed anxiety depression symptom first 25 month covid-19 pandemic , considering age group , socioeconomic status , gender . method longitudinal study 6 repeated measure conducted , involving 988 adult participant argentina . adapted version bdi-ii stai administered online questionnaire 2 , 14 , 50 , 130 , 390 , 750 day since start lockdown . result result showed sustained increase anxiety depression symptom 390 day , followed decrease anxiety initial level 750 day . depressive symptom significantly decreased 750 day remained higher initial level . conclusion woman consistently scored higher men , lower socioeconomic status individual reported symptom , younger individual higher anxiety depression , decreased age . surprisingly , older individual displayed better mental health indicator compared rest population .

title: Durational effect of ambient air pollution on hospital admissions of schizophrenia: a time series analysis
abstract: background schizophrenia may exacerbated ambient air pollution . study , aim explore association air pollution hospital admission schizophrenia liuzhou , china . method daily concentration air pollutant gathered average seven fixed monitoring site liuzhou , daily admission data schizophrenia received guangxi zhuang autonomous region brain hospital . poisson generalized linear regression model conjunction distributed lag nonlinear model utilized quantify exposure-lag-response connection ambient air pollution schizophrenia hospitalization . stratification analysis carried age , gender , season . result pm_2.5 , pm_10 , so_2 significantly associated elevated number schizophrenia hospitalization . observed largest single-day effect pm_2.5 lag 17 day , pm_10 lag 17 day , so_2 lag 28 day , corresponding rrs 1.01611 ( 95 % ci:1.00652–1.02579 ) , 1.01648 ( 95 % ci:1.00603–1.02704 ) , 1.02001 ( 95 % ci : 1.00001-1.04041 ) , respectively . stratification analysis revealed patient < 45 year old female vulnerable hospitalization due exposure pm_2.5 pm_10 . effect pm_2.5 pm_10 noticeable cooler season warmer one . conclusion study reveals exposed pm_2.5 , pm_10 , so_2 may increase chance schizophrenia hospitalization .

title: Special needs of refugees with substance use disorders from conflict-affected countries: a comparison with German-born individuals

title: Perinatal risk factors for young adults to be not engaged in employment, education or training (NEET) and its mediators: longitudinal analysis of the QLSCD cohort study
abstract: purpose 2019 , 31 % 14 % young woman men worldwide – respectively – reported engaged employment , education , training ( neet ) , important indicator long-term socioeconomic vulnerability . study examined developmental pathway leading neet status young adulthood investigating association perinatal adversity neet status mediating role adolescent externalizing behaviour . method data québec longitudinal study child development ( qlscd , n = 974 ) . latent class analysis identified four profile exposure 30 perinatal adversity : low adversity , reference group ; fetal growth adversity , includes participant experiencing adversity related growth problem utero birth ; delivery complication , includes participant – mother – experience complication birth ; familial adversity , includes participant experienced adversity related family life . association perinatal profile , neet status – self-reported age 21 year – putative mediating role externalizing behavioural problem ( self-reported age 15 17 ) investigated using structural equation modeling . result risk becoming neet age 21 higher child experienced familial ( = 3.19 [ 95 % ci : 2.31–4.40 ] , p < 0.001 ) fetal growth ( 2.03 [ 1.11–3.71 ] , p = 0.022 ) adversity . externalizing behaviour problem mediated association familial adversity neet status ( 1.17 [ 1.05–1.30 ] , p = 0.004 ) . conclusion intervention targeting perinatal risk factor adolescent mental health contribute effort prevent neet status young adulthood .

title: Moderate and severe depression increase the incidence of cholelithiasis: Results from Mendelian randomization study and the NHANES 2017-March 2020
abstract: background depression may contributing factor cholelithiasis . however , exact correlation cholelithiasis depression severity remains unclear . method first , two-sample mendelian randomization ( mr ) analysis performed validate previous research finding , utilizing separate datasets major depressive disorder ( mdd ) cholelithiasis . mdd dataset ( 135,458 case , 344,901 control ) came published gwas , cholelithiasis data ( 19,023 case , 195,144 control ) sourced finngen . primary analytical approach mr study inverse variance weighting ( ivw ) method . second , observational study based national health nutrition examination survey ( nhanes ) conducted explore relationship severity depression cholelithiasis . 7071 participant included observational study total . depression severity ( , mild , moderate , severe ) measured patient health questionnaire-9 ( phq-9 ) . weighted multivariable-adjusted logistic regression employed association depression severity cholelithiasis . result mr study , ivw analysis revealed mdd may increase risk cholelithiasis ( 1.25 , 95 % ci 1.07–1.45 , p = 0.004 ) . observational study showed moderate ( 1.06 , 95 % ci 1.00–1.11 , p = 0.037 ) severe ( 1.07 , 95 % ci 1.00–1.15 , p = 0.044 ) depression rise incidence cholelithiasis . however , significant association found mild depression cholelithiasis ( p = 0.275 ) . conclusion moderate severe depression might rise incidence cholelithiasis , mild depression may . validation prospective study necessary .

title: Associations of various internet device use and activities with depression in Chinese adolescents: gender and geographical differences
abstract: purpose chinese adolescent increasingly using multiple device engage various internet activity . study examined whether association diverse internet device use distinct activity depression among chinese adolescent differed gender geographical location . method used data china family panel study ( cfps ) , national survey conducted 2020. result regarding gender difference , time spent mobile device frequency watching short video associated higher level depression girl , opposite true boy . regarding geographical difference , moderate use mobile device ( 1–3 h per day ) desktop device ( < 1 h per day ) , including watching short video posting low-frequency wechat moment , associated lower risk depression among rural adolescent . long-time desktop device use ( > 1 h per day ) , playing online game , daily online learning , posting high-frequency wechat moment could increase risk depression . contrast , desktop device usage moderate mobile device use ( 1–3 h per day ) , represented watching short video posting low-frequency wechat moment , related depression among adolescent provincial capital , prefecture-level city , county . daily online learning , playing game , posting wechat moment frequently could relieve depression . conclusion risk factor depression related internet device use activity varied adolescent across gender geographical location .

title: Caregiver mental, behavioral, and social health during the COVID-19 pandemic in South Africa: results from the Asenze cohort study
abstract: purpose covid-19 pandemic subsequent lockdown significant impact well-being population globally , however , covid-19 mental health research done high-income country . study evaluates impact covid-19 lockdown mental well-being sequential group caregiver adolescent south africa . hypothesized caregiver experienced worse mental , emotional social health outcome pandemic , compared onset . method longitudinal data wave 3 asenze cohort , conducted 2019 2021 , used estimate multivariable regression association pandemic lockdown caregiver social support network , mental physical health related quality life , parenting stress , hazardous alcohol use , psychiatric disorder , intimate partner violence . result result show onset pandemic , caregiver experienced diminished social support network , worse physical health related quality life , improvement mental health related quality life compared pandemic . observed association pandemic lockdown parenting stress , hazardous alcohol use , presence psychiatric disorder , experience intimate partner violence . conclusion study show impact covid-19 mandated lockdown caregiver social support , mental physical health related quality life among caregiver adolescent south africa . given result , research needed discern modifiable risk factor intervened improve social support physical health related quality life , preserve mental health related quality life .

title: Case management for suicide prevention: a rapid review and evidence map
abstract: purpose suicide one top ten leading cause death general population member united state military . despite substantial resource invested preventing suicide civilian governmental agency , identifying effective approach remains challenge . method consistent continued need identify effective strategy , military stakeholder requested rapid review suicide prevention program incorporated trained , non-provider personnel ( e.g . , case manager , care navigator ) . found lack comprehensive review topic developed evidence map characterize current state research case management program suicide prevention . element evidence map included characteristic component relevant program , role case manager , outcome measured , indication effectiveness . result included four systematic review 30 article representing 27 study review . case management service applied differently across setting population result suicide-related outcome mixed . model approach multiple study showing evidence effectiveness included intensive case management ( icm ) multilevel , population-based program . program showed evidence effectiveness represented one study . conclusion help advance understanding effectiveness suicide prevention program incorporate case management , future study provide comprehensive description case management , including clear definition service description role ( e.g . , educational background , specific task performed , duration , type patient involvement ) .

title: The relationship between social isolation, depressive symptoms and cognitive function in older adults: a longitudinal mediation study in China
abstract: purpose social isolation cognitive impairment important public health issue affect quality life older adult . study aim clarify direction relationship illustrate mediating role played depressive symptom . method data 5399 respondent participated three longitudinal survey china health retirement longitudinal survey ( charls ) analyzed . cross-lagged panel model used determine longitudinal relationship social isolation , depressive symptom , cognitive function . result controlling confounders , higher level social isolation predicted subsequent severe cognitive function score ( wave1–wave2 : β = − 0.039 , se = 0.015 , p = 0.009 ; wave2–wave3 : β = − 0.057 , se = 0.017 , p = 0.001 ) , 37.5 % effect mediated depressive symptom ( β = − 0.002 , se = 0.001 , p = 0.022 ) . similarly , lower cognitive function predicted subsequent higher social isolation ( wave1–wave2 : β = − 0.062 , se = 0.014 , p < 0.001 ; wave2–wave3 : β = − 0.039 , se = 0.015 , p = 0.009 ) , depressive symptom play mediating role process ( β = − 0.001 , se = 0.001 , p = 0.072 ) . conclusion potential bidirectional relationship social isolation cognitive function depressive symptom play partially mediating role .

title: Loneliness and health-related quality of life in Chinese adolescents: the mediating role of depressive symptoms and the moderating role of age
abstract: purpose despite alarming prevalence loneliness adolescent , study addressed impact health-related quality life ( hrqol ) . study aimed investigate association loneliness hrqol adolescent , well mediating role depressive symptom moderating role age association . method cross-sectional study surveyed 6743 middle school adolescent , assessing loneliness 6-item ucla loneliness scale hrqol pediatric quality life inventory version 4.0. depressive symptom assessed patient health questionnaire-9 . pearson correlation analysis performed determine correlation among main variable . moderated mediation analysis established evaluate mediating role depressive symptom moderating role age association loneliness hrqol . result participating adolescent , 25.0 % ( 1687 ) reported experiencing high-level loneliness . finding revealed significant association loneliness lower score across hrqol dimensional summary scale . specifically , every additional point loneliness score , hrqol total scale score changed −2.06 ( 95 % ci : −2.13 −2.00 ) point . depressive symptom identified partial mediator , mediation effect ranging 24.31 % social functioning 62.50 % school functioning . additionally , age negatively moderated link loneliness depressive symptom mediation model . conclusion link loneliness poorer hrqol adolescent highlighted need prioritize vulnerable group . finding also indicated importance addressing depressive symptom age difference among lonely adolescent preserve hrqol .

title: Predictors of anxiety among women of reproductive age in Nepal: a comprehensive nationwide analysis
abstract: purpose objective anxiety pose significant challenge woman reproductive age globally , often leading mental health issue . however , research anxiety prevalence among demographic , particularly nepal , remains scarce . study aim fill gap identifying demographic , biological , behavioral predictor anxiety among reproductive-aged woman nepal . method using data nationally representative nepal demographic health survey 2022 , study employed generalized anxiety disorder ( gad-7 ) scale anxiety prevalence . descriptive inferential statistic , including one-way anova stepwise multiple regression , utilized identifying potential predictor anxiety . result study found 22.2 % reproductive-aged woman nepal experience moderate severe anxiety . stepwise multiple regression revealed seven influential factor , depression ( mild , moderate , severe ) influential predictor anxiety , explaining 51.8 % variance ( r square change = 0.518 ; sig . = < 0.001 ) . self-reported health status ( r square change = 0.010 ; sig.= < 0.001 ) , experienced emotional violence ( r square change = 0.007 ; sig.= < 0.001 ) , pregnancy termination ( r square change = 0.002 ; sig.=0.001 ) accounted 1.0 % , 0.7 % , 0.2 % variance anxiety , respectively . significant predictor anxiety included husband ’ alcohol consumption , genital discharge , household wealth status . conclusion anxiety substantially prevalent among reproductive-aged woman nepal , sociodemographic factor playing crucial role . research needed develop targeted socioeconomic , behavioral intervention aimed addressing anxiety broader impact daily life , thereby ensuring mental well-being woman reproductive age .

title: Cultural stress and mental health among Venezuelan migrants: cross-national evidence from 2017 to 2024
abstract: background since 2015 , ~ 8 million venezuelan fled latin america ’ prosperous nation , many relocating nearby colombia others migrating united state ( u.s. ) . emerging research suggests migration-related cultural stress challenge venezuelan related increased risk mental health problem . however , remains uncertain cultural stress mental health outcome manifest time across country . method use independent sample -tests compare survey data multiple study venezuelan migrant bogotá medellín , colombia , u.s. state florida . data collected include self-report measure discrimination , negative context reception ( ncr ) , depression post-traumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) screening diagnosis , collected distinct cross-national cohort 2017 ( n = 638 ) 2023–2024 ( n = 1241 ) . result self-reported ncr discrimination consistently higher among venezuelan migrant colombia among venezuelan florida . level cultural stress within country variable , ncr decreasing across year florida discrimination increasing florida colombia . many venezuelan migrant reported symptom mental health problem , half sample colombia ( 54–56 % ) two-fifths sample florida ( 39–41 % ) screening positive depression 2017 2023–2024 . individual exposed higher level cultural stress substantially likely screen positive depression ptsd . conclusion study first examine cultural stress mental health among venezuelan migrant across national context different stage still-unfolding international migration crisis .

title: Does help-seeking mediate the relationship between the masculine norm of self-reliance and suicidal thoughts among men?
abstract: purpose study aimed explore relationship masculine norm self-reliance suicidal thought among australian men , hypothesising lack help-seeking might mediate relationship high self-reliance emergence suicidal thought . method study used data australian longitudinal study male health ‘ ten men ’ , prospective longitudinal cohort study began 2013/2014 boy men aged 10–55 year ( n = 16,021 ) wave 1. focus men participated wave 1 2 ( 2013/2014 , 2015/2016 ) linked administrative data . causal mediation analysis conducted quantify total effect self-reliance wave 1 suicidal thought wave 2 , investigate extent mediation help-seeking wave 1 2. result high self-reliance associated increased odds suicidal thought ( = 1.46 , 95 % ci 1.24–1.72 ) . however , significant mediating effect lack help-seeking relationship self-reliance suicidal thought ( = 1.00 , 95 % ci 0.99–1.01 ) . conclusion finding suggest highly self-reliant men increased risk experiencing suicidal thought ; however , relationship explained lack help-seeking . future study could explore potential mechanism better understand highly self-reliant men likely experience suicidal thought .

abstract: purpose risk acute infection patient first ever diagnosed depression compared patient diagnosed depression primary-care database . method conducted cohort study using uk cprd gold database ( 2000–2019 ) . identified patient aged 18 year older recorded read code depression ( cohort entry date ) compared patient read code depression using risk set sampling . comparison group frequency-matched age sex , comparison patient required ≥ 1 general practitioner ( gp ) contact within 14 day cohort entry . primary outcome composite outpatient diagnosed acute infection , including respiratory , gastrointestinal , urogenital infection septicemia ) within two-years cohort entry . applied propensity score fine stratification estimated incidence rate ir ratio ( irr ) using negative binomial regression . result weighted population 285,922 patient diagnosed depression 285,921 comparison patient , ir acute infection 97.3/1000 person-years ( py ) patient 83.7/1000 py patient diagnosed depression . weighted irr acute infection 1.18 ( 95 % ci 1.16–1.20 ) comparing diagnosed depression . excluding patient baseline comorbidities yielded irr even closer null : 1.07 ( 95 % ci , 1.04–1.09 ) . conclusion result suggest patient diagnosed depression meaningfully increased risk acute infection compared patient diagnosed depression . slightly increased overall relative risk infection explained residual difference health care utilization severity comorbidities .

title: Racial discrimination and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander suicide mortality rates in Queensland
abstract: objective study aimed examine association experience racial discrimination within community suicide mortality rate aboriginal torres strait islander people . method age-standardised suicide rate ( asrs ) calculated using suicide recorded queensland suicide register ( qsr ) aboriginal torres strait islander people queensland 2009 2015. rate ratio ( rrs ) used compare asrs area high low level reported discrimination , comparative community-level risk protective factor ( remoteness , socio-economic resource , indigenous language use ) . result age-standardised suicide rate 31.74 death per 100 000 persons/year aboriginal torres strait islander people year 2009–2015 . asrs significantly higher area first nation resident experienced recent discrimination ( rr = 1.33 ; 95 % ci = 1.05–1.70 , p = 0.02 ) , age-specific suicide rate significantly higher aged 25–34 area discrimination ( rr = 1.67 ; 95 % ci = 1.04–2.74 , p = 0.03 ) . comparison , asrs significantly higher area regional remote community ( rr = 1.10 , ci 95 % =0.75–1.61 , p = 0.60 ) , area lower socioeconomic resource ( rr = 0.86 , 95 % ci = 0.66–1.13 , p = 0.28 ) . area first nation resident spoke indigenous language significantly lower asrs ( rr = 0.71 ; ci95 % =0.53–0.95 , p = 0.02 ) . conclusion suicide mortality rate aboriginal torres strait islander people queensland influenced experience racial discrimination within community indigenous language use , greater association reported socio-economic resource remoteness . finding reflect public health risk discrimination provide evidence enacting strategy reduce institutional personal discrimination reduce suicide .

The impact of minimum wage increase on suicidal ideation in South Korea: a difference-in-differences analysis using nationally representative panel data
abstract: background south korea highest suicide rate oecd one largest ( 16.4 % ) increase minimum wage 2018. prior study provided evidence increase minimum wage reduce suicide rate population , study examined effect policy change individual-level suicidal behaviour . method study sample built using 2015–2019 wave korean welfare panel survey , population-representative longitudinal survey . sample consisted 5146 participant , including earning minimum wage ( control ) minimum wage earner ( treatment ) based 2018/19 earnings . outcome study suicidal ideation , important precursor suicidal behaviour , captured using self-reported measure . examined impact 2018 minimum wage hike korea suicidal ideation , using difference-in-differences design . result minimum wage increase associated 1.6 % point reduction ( 95 % ci : -2.8 % -0.5 % ) self-reported suicidal ideation . stronger policy effect shown among woman older age group . conclusion study demonstrates public policy employing population-based approach , increasing minimum wage , could serve effective intervention mitigate suicidal ideation among low-income worker .

title: Using random forest to identify correlates of depression symptoms among adolescents
abstract: purpose adolescent depression significant public health concern , studying multifaceted factor using traditional method posse challenge . study employ random forest ( rf ) algorithm determine factor predicting adolescent depression score . method study utilized self-reported survey data 56,008 canadian student ( grade 7–12 ) attending 182 school 2021/22 academic year . rf algorithm applied identify correlate ( ) depression score ( cesd-r-10 ) ( ii ) presence clinically relevant depression ( cesd-r-10 ≥ 10 ) . result rf achieved 71 % explained variance , accurately predicting depression score within 3.40 unit margin . top 10 correlate identified rf included measure mental health ( anxiety symptom , flourishing , emotional dysregulation ) , home life ( excessive parental expectation , happy home life , ability talk family ) , school connectedness , sleep duration , gender . predicting clinically relevant depression , algorithm showed 84 % accuracy , 0.89 sensitivity , 0.79 auroc , aligning closely correlate identified depression score . conclusion study highlight rf ’ utility identifying important correlate adolescent depressive symptom . rf ’ natural hierarchy offer advantage traditional method . finding underscore importance additional potential sleep health promotion school belonging initiative preventing adolescent depression .

title: Suicide rates before and during the COVID-19 pandemic: a systematic review and meta-analysis
abstract: purpose effect covid-19 pandemic mental health issue depression anxiety well-documented literature , influence suicidal pattern show divergent result . aim comprehensively synthesize evidence potential change stability suicide rate covid-19 pandemic worldwide . method comprehensive search study reporting suicide rate covid-19 pandemic conducted . eligible study reported incidence confirmed suicide ( suspected special case ) two time period , ( february 2020 ) ( march 2020 june 2021 ) covid-19 pandemic . meta-analysis proportion using random-effect model performed estimate pre- during-pandemic incidence rate suicide 95 % confidence interval . difference pre- during-pandemic rate formally tested using heterogeneity test . result total 34 study included review capturing suicide data 40 country region . meta-analysis output indicate significant change suicide rate covid-19 pandemic . pooled suicide rate studied period pandemic 11.38 per 100,000 ( 95 % ci 9.35–13.42 ) period pandemic 10.65 per 100,000 ( 95 % ci 8.61–12.68 ) . conclusion significant change suicide rate observed covid pandemic global perspective period examined . longer follow-up provide additional insight suicide trend globally . improvement data reporting , specifically implementation real-time surveillance , imperative provide adequate suicide prevention support .

title: Testing a syndemics perspective on the effects of multiple adversities on depression and anxiety symptoms in a representative population sample
abstract: purpose considerable empirical evidence indicates stressful life experience may negative impact mental health . however , unclear multiple adverse experience may intersect influence symptom depression anxiety . using syndemics approach identify potential synergistic effect major stressor , aimed quantify role multiple recent adverse life experience depression anxiety symptom . method population-representative sample 1090 australian adult ( 53 % woman , m_age 47 year ) completed cross-sectional survey 2022 assessed mental health retrospective report nine specific stressful life experience past year . result common adverse life experience past year financial problem ( 64 % ) , loneliness ( 63 % ) , major health problem ( 51 % ) . multivariate logistic regression analysis , financial problem , personal health problem , health problem close contact , relationship problem loneliness significantly associated depression anxiety symptom ( p < 0.05 ) . one synergistic interaction one buffering interaction combined adversity anxiety , synergistic interaction adverse experience depression . perceived impact combined adversity associated depression ( b = 0.59 , p < 0.001 ) anxiety ( b = 0.48 , p < 0.001 ) . conclusion adversity strongly associated depression anxiety . inconsistent syndemics framework , synergistic relationship different type adversity , suggesting different adverse experience may independently influence mental health . finding indicate important opportunity early intervention prevent depression anxiety difficult time .

title: Poverty and birth cohort effects of experiencing the 2007–2009 Great Recession during adolescence on major depressive episodes and mental health treatment of young adults in the United States
abstract: purpose household economic adversity adolescence hypothesized risk factor poor mental health later life . test hypothesis , conducted quasi-experimental analysis economic shock , great recession 2007–2009 . tested going adolescence great recession associated increased risk major depressive episode ( mde ) mental health treatment young adulthood potential moderation household poverty explore difference economic adversity . method analyzed data young adult age 18–29 year 2005–2019 national survey drug use health ( n = 145,394 ) . compared participant adolescent recession followed-up prior recession . regression analysis tested effect modification household poverty status . result adolescent exposure great recession associated higher likelihood mde young adulthood ( aor = 1.30 , 95 % ci = 1.23 , 1.37 ) ; relationship mental health treatment . effect mde stronger among household higher income compared living poverty . conclusion finding support hypothesis exposure great recession adolescence may increased risk mde , raise question whether mechanism association economic distress .
