title: Discrepancies in prevalence estimates of suicidal ideation and attempts in 18- to 22-year-old US college students: a comparison of three surveys
abstract: purpose suicidal thought behavior ( stb ) increasing among u college student . accurate measurement stb key understanding trend guiding suicide prevention effort . aimed compare prevalence estimate stb among college student two campus-based survey ( national college health assessment [ ncha ] healthy mind study [ hm ] ) one general population study ( national survey drug use health [ nsduh ] ) . method estimate generated three survey past year suicidal ideation ( pysi ) past year suicide attempt ( pysa ) among 18- 22-year-old full-time college student . data combined survey develop bivariate multivariate regression model odds pysi pysa . result estimate pysi varied three survey : 34.3 % ncha , 15.0 % hm , 10.7 % nsduh . estimate pysa 2.6 % ncha , 1.6 % hm , 1.7 % nsduh . adjusting demographic educational characteristic , odds pysi remained significantly lower hm participant ( aor 0.31 , 95 % ci 0.29–0.33 ) nsduh participant ( aor 0.19 , 95 % ci 0.19–0.30 ) compared ncha participant . odds pysa hm participant lower ncha participant ( aor 0.63 , 95 % ci 0.54–0.73 ) . conclusion estimate pysi pysa vary leading source data college student mental health . difference likely related question wording , survey implementation , well institutional individual representation . accounting difference interpreting estimate stb help guide suicide prevention effort .

title: Replacement of sedentary behavior with various physical activities and the risk of incident depression: a prospective analysis of accelerator-measured and self-reported UK Biobank data
abstract: purpose examine dose‒response relationship sedentary behavior ( sb ) physical activity ( pa ) depression , explore effect replacing sb pa depression risk . method study used data uk biobank aged 37 73 year . light physical activity ( lpa ) , moderate-to-vigorous activity ( mvpa ) , sleep duration , total sedentary behavior ( tsb ) measured accelerometer . self-reported sb also adopted daily screen-sedentary behavior time ( ssb ) leisure-sedentary behavior time ( lsb ) focus . incident depression obtained part mental behavioral disorder “ first occurrence field ” uk biobank . cox proportional hazard model isotemporal substitution model performed explore association lpa , mvpa , tsb , lsb , ssb , sleep depression effect replacing sb time equal pa time . result highest level mvpa ( hr = 0.58 , 95 % ci : 0.50-0.68 ) associated decreased depression risk compared lowest level ( q1 ) . longer ssb time ( hr = 1.18 , 95 % ci : 1.06-1.32 ) , lsb time ( hr = 1.19 , 95 % ci : 1.07-1.32 ) , tsb time ( hr = 1.17 , 95 % ci : 1.00-1.38 ) could increase depression risk significantly . replacing 1h/day tsb , ssb , lsb mvpa brought greatest risk reduction [ 31 % ( hr = 0.69 , 95 % ci : 0.62-0.77 ) , 30 % ( hr = 0.70 , 95 % ci : 0.65-0.77 ) , 29 % ( hr = 0.71 , 95 % ci : 0.65-0.77 ) ] . condition , effect lpa replacement also significant , weaker mvpa . subgroup analysis showed replacing 1h/d tsb lpa could significantly decrease depression risk female , male . conclusion large benefit reducing risk incident depression could attained replacing period tsb , ssb , lsb equal pa time , especially mvpa . regular pa le sb recommended improving mental health .

title: Depression and suicidal ideation among Black individuals in Canada: mediating role of traumatic life events and moderating role of racial microaggressions and internalized racism

title: The impact of comorbid psychiatric disorders on chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) hospitalizations: a nationwide retrospective study
abstract: aim characterize register secondary diagnosis mental illness chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( copd ) hospitalization registered portugal 2008 2015 explore impact hospitalization outcome . method retrospective observational study conducted . hospitalization patient least 40 year old , discharged 2008 2015 primary diagnosis copd ( icd-9-cm code 491.x , 492.x 496 ) retrieved national administrative database . comorbid psychiatric diagnosis identified defined hcup clinical classification software ( cc ) category code 650–670 ( excluding 662 ) . length hospital stay ( los ) , admission type , in-hospital mortality , estimated hospital charge analyzed according psychiatric diagnostic category using sex age-adjusted model . result 66,661 copd hospitalization , 25,869 ( 38.8 % ) episode registered psychiatric comorbidity . likely correspond younger inpatient ( = 2.16 , 95 % ci 2.09–2.23 ; p < 0.001 ) , stay longer hospital ( aor = 1.08 , 95 % ci 1.05–1.12 ; p < 0.001 ) , incur higher estimated hospital charge ( aor = 1.37 , 95 % ci 1.33–1.42 ; p < 0.001 ) urgently admitted ( aor = 1.33 , 95 % ci 1.23–1.44 ; p < 0.001 ) . adjustment age , in-hospital mortality lower episode psychiatric diagnosis ( aor = 0.90 ; 95 % ci 0.84–0.96 ; p < 0.001 ) , except organic neurodegenerative disease category developmental disorder , intellectual disability disorder usually diagnosed infancy , childhood , adolescence category . discussion finding corroborate additional burden placed psychiatric disorder copd hospitalization , highlighting importance individualizing care address comorbidities minimize impact treatment outcome .

abstract: purpose study aimed examine childhood neighbourhood quality , peer relationship , trajectory depressive symptom among middle-aged older chinese adult . method data came longitudinal dataset china health retirement longitudinal study ( charls , 2011–2018 ) . depressive symptom measured repeatedly using ten-item centre epidemiologic study depression scale ( ces-d-10 ) . latent growth modelling used capture trajectory depressive symptom childhood neighbourhood quality , peer relationship . result mean level depressive symptom increased gradually follow-up period . poorer childhood neighbourhood quality , peer relationship significantly associated higher level depression later life ( β = 0.18 β = 0.28 aged 45–59 , p < 0.001 ; β = 0.16 β = 0.33 aged 60 , p < 0.001 ) baseline faster increase depressive symptom age childhood neighbourhood quality ( β = 0.03 , p < 0.01 aged 45–59 ; β = 0.05 , p < 0.01 aged 60 ) . male female , poorer childhood neighbourhood quality , peer relationship predicted higher level depression baseline ( β = 0.17 β = 0.36 male , p < 0.001 ; β = 0.16 β = 0.27 female , p < 0.001 ) , neighbourhood quality associated higher rate change depression follow-up ( β = 0.03 , β = 0.04 , p < 0.05 , respectively ) . conclusion poorer childhood neighbourhood quality associated slope change depressive symptom . effort towards improving childhood living condition may help prevent detrimental health effect early life disadvantage .

title: Neighborhood disadvantage and adolescent behavior problems: how do inferences differ across definitions of disadvantage?
abstract: background various definition neighborhood disadvantage ( nd ) exist , yet evidence lacking nd operationalization may impact scientific inference . method used data wave 6 fragile family study , excluding without census tract behavior problem data ( n = 2363 ) . outcome included five scale caregiver-reported child behavior checklist ( cbcl ) self-reported delinquency scale . nd defined four way : ( 1 ) modified sampson definition included four neighborhood poverty variable ; ( 2 ) poverty-only definition included percent household poverty ; ( 3 ) overextended definition added mediator nd-behavior relationship , ( 4 ) expanded definition added six additional nd variable modified sampson definition . using effect estimate generalized linear model , difference calculated using percent change-in-estimate , modified sampson referent . result effect estimate similar modified sampson expanded definition ( < 5 % difference ) . poverty-only definition differed modified sampson unsystematically . estimate overextended definition consistently larger compared modified sampson ( 10–37 % greater ) . expanded modified sampson definition produced similar result . conclusion poverty-only overextended nd definition interpreted caution .

title: Factors associated with new onset of father-to-infant bonding failure from 1 to 6 months postpartum: an adjunct study of the Japan environment and children’s study
abstract: purpose study aimed determine factor associated new onset father-to-infant ( paternal ) bonding failure 1 6 month postpartum . method prospective birth-cohort study . paternal bonding failure evaluated using japanese version mother-to-infant bonding scale ( mibs-j ) 1 6 month postpartum . cut-off score , overall bonding failure , mibs-j total score ≥ 5 ; subscale lack affection , mibs-j_la score ≥ 3 ; subscale anger/rejection , mibs-j_ar score ≥ 3 used study . multivariate regression analysis performed analyze relative variable . result analyzed 872 father . frequency new-onset overall bonding failure , lack affection , anger/rejection 5.6 % , 4.9 % , 6.3 % , respectively . new-onset overall bonding failure , significant associated factor paternal childcare leave ( adjusted odds ratio [ aor ] 3.192 ; 95 % confidence interval [ ci ] 1.203–8.469 ) , paternal new-onset depression symptom ( aor 3.181 ; 95 % cl 1.311–7.716 ) , maternal new-onset overall bonding failure ( aor 4.595 ; 95 % cl 1.119–18.866 ) . new-onset lack affection , significant associated factor preterm birth ( aor 4.189 ; 95 % cl 1.473–11.913 ) paternal new-onset depression symptom ( aor 3.290 ; 95 % cl 1.294–8.362 ) . new-onset anger rejection , significant associated factor paternal childcare leave ( aor 3.142 ; 95 % cl 1.138–8.676 ) , paternal new-onset depression symptom ( aor 2.829 ; 95 % cl 1.133–7.068 ) , maternal new-onset anger/rejection ( aor 7.064 ; 95 % cl 2.300–21.700 ) . conclusion factor associated new-onset paternal bonding failure 1 6 month postpartum paternal childcare leave , preterm birth , paternal postpartum depression symptom , maternal bonding failure .
keywords: Japanese version of the Mother-to-Infant Bonding Scale (MIBS-J)

abstract: purpose social determinant health ( sdoh ) refer condition environment people live affect health outcome risk . sdoh may provide proximal , actionable target intervention . study examined sdoh associated posttraumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) depression symptom among veteran non-veterans probable ptsd depression . method four multiple regression conducted . two multiple regression veteran examined impact sdoh ptsd symptom depression symptom . two multiple regression non-veterans examined impact sdoh ptsd symptom depression symptom . independent variable included demographic characteristic , adverse experience ( childhood adulthood ) , sdoh ( discrimination , education , employment , economic instability , homelessness , justice involvement , social support ) . correlate statistically significant ( p < 0.05 ) clinically meaningful ( r _part > |0.10| ) interpreted . result veteran , lower social support ( r _part = − 0.14 ) unemployment ( r _part = 0.12 ) associated greater ptsd symptom . among non-veterans , greater economic instability ( r _part = 0.19 ) associated greater ptsd symptom . depression model , lower social support ( r _part = − 0.23 ) greater economic instability ( r _part = 0.12 ) associated greater depression veteran , lower social support associated greater depression non-veterans ( r _part = − 0.14 ) . conclusion among veteran non-veterans probable ptsd depression , sdoh associated ptsd depression symptom , particularly social support , economic instability , employment . beyond direct treatment mental health symptom , addressing social support economic factor instability employment context ptsd depression potential intervention target would benefit future research .
